results.description:
Please include your email and first name in the comment space below!

Prior to the meeting, I will share a picture with which you will write one scene (can be first person, third person, backstory, present-tense, dialogue, no dialogue - whatever works). Let's aim for one page double spaced. In addition, we'll read one (SHORT) short story before Sunday and discuss the following elements:

Scene & elements of scene including:
- POV (how does this effect the way we read the story)
- Dialogue (Does it work? - how does it push the scene along)
- Characters (How many?)
- Setting (Where are we?)
- How MANY scenes?
- Any backstory? And we'll answer one question: What element is most crucial to the story and why?

This is a FICTION WRITING workshop - for writers of any level. The goal is to analyze other authors' work as well as strengthen our own, and over the next few months develop what we have into a full, working, story. We'll start with scene - you can't have a story without scene ;)

Please only RSVP if you are definitely planning to attend.
results.name: Meeting #2

What rules can we apply? How are these rules valid or invalid?  What are the limits to these rules?  How do these rule change with different relationships or when safety is a factor?  How does our values or biases matte?

How does one discern when a person is faking it? 


Purpose: Explore how does one discern a "good" person?

What rules can we apply? How are these rules valid or invalid?  What are the limits to these rules?  How do these rule change in different relationships or when safety is a factor?  How does our values or biases matte?

Join our discussion.  Bring your collective wisdom.

results.description:
Join us for another great night of Cinema Italiano on Sunday Feb21st!

Se Dio Vuole, 2015 -  by Edoardo Falcone 
with: Marco Giallini, Alessandro Gassmann, Laura Morante and Ilaria Spada

                    In Italian with English Subtitles

After the movie, as always, we'll enjoy complimentary beer offered by our sponsor Peroni at Emporio Restaurant, around the corner on Mott Street!

                       --> Get Your Tickets Here <--

        Watch the Trailer here: cinemaitalianony.com

This recent Italian box-office success won Best New Director for Edoardo Falcone at the recent Italian Oscars and tells the hilarious story of an atheist surgeon with a God-complex, a charismatic priest, a dysfunctional family and an announcement that takes everyone by surprise. 

Tommaso (Marco Giallini) is a successful, respected surgeon who also happens to be conceited, proud and arrogant – and a staunch atheist. However, Tommaso’s pedestal is set to be removed from beneath him when his only son Andrea brings the family together for an entirely unexpected announcement...

WINNER

Best New Director – David di Donatello Awards 2015

Best New Director – Italian National Syndicate of Film Journalists 2015

NOMINATED
Best Actor - David di Donatello Awards 2015

results.description:
In this workshop you will find ideal full body movement to keep your diaphragm at its happiest so that it will support your voice most easily! Vocal strength starts to increase all on its own now and more tonal and articulation clarity is another benefit. We will start with the BreathingRx For Singers warm up and bring back the full body balance and release movement qualities for each section of the body, (while singing something fun!). I will show you how to do the world’s fastest warm up and we will bring in a little dance move to free up the diaphragm even more. You will then find your individual movement style dialing in the whole body in ideal release and activity for singing! This is where the magic starts to happen…
Singers, voice teachers, actors and speakers are invited to come and gain an appreciation about why this work is setting a new standard for vocal support. And, it also increases your expressiveness and joy!
This workshop will be filmed to be turned into an e-course product and for your participation you will be given access to all 6 workshops for your continued study. Bring a song or aria you know well.
I have designed this 5th workshop in a series of 6 so it can be individually attended. The tuition for this workshop is $35. If ordered here. Registration is limited. Book your seat now by clicking here that you will attend. The system will lead you through registration. If the system does not take your registration you can register at this link at eventbright... contact me if you have any other questions...
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/loosen-up-tension-releasefind-your-ideal-style-of-movement-tickets-21073987865

See you at the workshop!

results.description:
Photo Credit: Jazzville, NJ member, Maurice Jefferson

Please note that we're doing Third Sunday this month due to Valentine's Day..

Robin's Nest in Linden is truly one of the friendliest venues we've ever been to. Walk in once and you're part of the family.

Plus, it doesn't hurt that the open jam session lets everyone join in the fun. Musicians and vocalists are invited to get on stage and join the band for a few songs.

Over the years, we've had members grace us with their talents and it's always fun to see someone you know join the band for a few numbers.

There is no cover and the food is excellent, so bring an appetite!

Your GPS is not misleading you

Robin's Nest is in a very residential area. Most first-timers think their GPS is taking them the wrong way. Just continue to follow it. Once you get to the club, it's very visible amongst all the houses.

A Note About Parking

It's a small lot and double parking is common. If you are on a time schedule, it's best to park on the street so you don't get blocked in.

The area around the club is very safe and there is plenty of space on the surrounding streets.

How To Find Us

Robin's Nest is a cozy little place, so you shouldn't have any trouble locating us, but if this is your first time joining the group, you might not recognize us right away.

Here are three easy ways to find us:

• look for the Jazzville, NJ Meetup sign: http://bit.ly/zBZxVL

• look for me: http://bit.ly/zP11QP

• ask at the bar for the "Jazzville, NJ Meetup" group

Don't be shy! Come introduce yourself and partake in the music and merryment!

peace and jazz,

D.A.
results.why: Robin's Nest is the place to be on Sunday evenings! If you're a singer or musician, you can join the band on stage. If you're not, just get ready to be blown away by the talent!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the door or the bar for the Jazzville Meetup group or look for the Meetup sign.
results.name: **THIRD** Sunday: Cool Jazz Open Jam @ Robin's Nest, Linden

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

The sacred Vedic scriptures state that man and the entire Universe have been created from sound. All matter is energy vibrating at different frequencies. By altering the rate of vibration we can change the structure of matter, including healing ourselves by restoring the normal vibratory frequencies of out-of-harmony parts of the body.
Long known only to the initiated, the singing bowls have been used since ancient times in India and the Himalayas for healing and as meditation aids to help transcend into higher states of consciousness.

Our body has its own built-in healing system. Sounds and music are powerful tools for bringing our physical, psychological and spiritual selves back into harmony. The special frequencies and sound patterns produced by the singing bowls have been shown to affect a remarkable and swift improvement with physical, mental and emotional issues.

Singing bowls help in all areas of our Being, including

• Deep relaxation
• Mental clarity, increased energy and positive outlook
• Increased self-confidence and creative potential
• Releasing negative patterns, e.g. past relationships or worries and fears
• Relieving tension and blockages, releasing toxins
• Stimulating optimal functioning of cells, tissues and organs
• Improving the functioning of all physiological systems, e.g. nervous system, digestive, circulatory, lymphatic, cardio-vascular and endocrine
• Alleviating physical pain, e.g. backache, joints, headaches, etc.

Guy Yair Beider is highly trained and certified by “Nine Ways Academy” in the Himalayan sound healing arts. He has performed numerous sound meditations, concerts and workshops, and also conducts individual healing sessions.

results.description:
Each week following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity dozens of people get together following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity for socializing, eating, beverages and connecting.  It is a fun and casual way to meet others in the group in a fun and relaxed setting.

You can meet the group on the steps to the church following mass and walk over together or you can meet the group at the bar.  It is easy to find us.

Blondies has been a great supporter for CRC events over the years and this is a nice way to thank them by showing our support for the local businesses that support us. They are an sports bar with a very casual atmosphere. You can sit at the bar, stand and socialize or sit at tables with others.We have the back room reserved


Pay as you go for food and drink. A full menu is available

Can I come alone? Yes, many of those attending come on their own.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity to attend? No, people come from all over the tri state area to our events.

Do I need to go to the 5:30 mass to go to the gathering?  No, you can attend your home parish and join us for the party. 

How long does it last?

Usually around 9ish
results.name: After Mass Gathering at Blondies Private Back Room Space

group.name: Holy Trinity Church - Contemporary Roman Catholics  NYC

results.description:
Practice and polish your original song or cover at home...then bring your guitar (or ukulele, violin, harmonica etc.) and meet at Fontana's to perform in a warm and encouraging environment. Meet your friendly fellow performers.  This is a beginner's open mic, especially for people relatively new to live performance. Bands are welcome, too--just make sure you bring a snare drum, kick pedal and cymbals if you need those.

To partially offset the cost of running the open mic there is a $5 fee for each performer (bands, please note each member needs to sign up).

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Jan 24, 2016 - March 6th
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:  Feb 7th No class!
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452342

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135393">

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408"></a>

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Hosted By: Leah Bonnema, Gary Vider. Gregory K (Orange is the New Black), Seaton Smith (Comedy Central), Damien Lemon (MTV), Jeff Leach (Comedy Central) and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

Remember its a 2 drink minimum like any other comedy club or jazz club runs like $18. I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up New York Free, 2 drnk min Gregory from Russia

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
5v5 indoor gym soccer

With a smaller field and fewer players on a team, the quick-paced indoor soccer game helps players keep in shape and sharpen skills during the cold winter months. 

Why play with us:

Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.   Share a laugh, conversation, and talk about your favorite soccer player. It's a fun workout indoors. We sometimes go out after our games.

Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.
results.name: Indoor gym soccer-Fleetwood

CALLING ALL DEAD FANS, KARMA is gracious enough to provide us their upstairs lounge complete with comfy sofas and large screen viewer with surround sound to watch THIS SEASON's WALKING DEAD!!!


Karma will have dinner and drink specials just for us. We usually watch the previous episode from 8-9pm casually with the lights up and discuss our theories and predictions about the show .

Then stay for the main event! Be warned: The lights go down and it will get pretty quiet once the 9pm episode begins.

results.name: Watch the next episode of The Walking Dead Season 6

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

Hope you are all well and enjoying the Fall.

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

All you need to do is relax, and intend to receive the Weight Loss Energy Transmission from Jae.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

All you need to do is to RSVP so that you are on the list.

Please RSVP for each week that want to be included so that I know you're in.

Hope you'll participate in the next Weight Loss Challenge in October!

I'd love to see you!

Hope to see you real soon!

 

All the very best,

Jae

results.description:
*** If you haven't joined our Facebook group yet, make sure you do! That's where a lot of the action happens: links to our photo albums, extra workouts, happy hours, random funny meme postings, you name it!

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet by the fountain in the middle of the park.
results.name: HIIT Workout

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Open your heart

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.
results.name: Weekly Photo Project - Open your heart

results.description:
Hello everyone. No doubt you noticed things have been a bit quiet recently. This is because I've been busy creating a lot of new work!

Since February 1st I have been enrolled in three classes at the Art Students League here in NYC, which gives me regular access to a larger, better equipped workspace.

As luck would have it, the three courses I enrolled in at the League are all having their Student Concours this week, February 22–27, and I will have several works on view during this time.

There will be three receptions—one for each class—so please come say “Hi" and see my work and the work of my talented colleagues. The reception times are as follows:

- Monday, February 22nd, 6–8pm
- Thursday, February 25th, 6–8pm
- Saturday, February 27th, 12–2pm

The Concours and the receptions will take place at:

Phyllis Harriman Mason Gallery, 2nd Floor
Art Students League
215 West 57th Street

It is between 7th Avenue and Broadway. The exhibition is free and open to the public from 9am to 8:30pm Monday–Friday, and Saturday 9am to 3pm.

So this is not a typical Meetup event, but I hope you'll stop by nonetheless. Stay tuned for more upcoming events. There's a lot happening in the art world in March!

I hope to see you soon!
results.name: Art Students League Student Concours

results.description:
Ernesto Bailey---cat killer----plead guilty at his trial. As such Bailey could have faced a maximum sentence of 2 years under New York Agriculture and Markets Law statute 353-A.

Instead......

JUDGE WILLIAM I. MOGULESCU,

in what must be the most MORONIC ruling in history,


STATED HE WOULD NOT GIVE BAILEY THE MAXIMUM SENTENCE; HE WOULD INCARCERATE HIM FOR ONLY ONE YEAR.

Bailey is currently being held at the Vernon C. Bain Correctional Center a jail barge. He'll be brought out to be formally sentenced.


The Daily News photographer will be there to photograph him in a prison uniform. This is our last chance to infuriate Bailey with our presence.

There is no excuse for animal abuse.

We do not forgive. We do not forget animal abuse.


On July 25th, Ernesto Bailey, was arrested in the Bronx for torturing a cat to death by setting it on fire.

At 11 a.m. officers responded to a report about a dead animal in front of 690 East 182nd Street. According to the NYPD, a building superintendent showed the cops a video "of a male pouring fluid on a cat who was lying on the ground in front of the location. The male then proceeded to use a lighter to light the cat on fire before fleeing."

After seeing the suspect in the video, they canvassed the building and found Ernesto Bailey, 31, in his apartment and arrested him. He has been charged with aggravated cruelty to animals, torture of an animal, reckless endangerment and arson. The police released a photograph of the sidewalk where the arson occurred, as well as a truly distressing photo of the dead cat.


DATE: February 22, 2016

COURT: Bronx Supreme Court –Criminal Term Part 26

265 E161st St.

Bronx, NY 10451

JUDGE: MOGULESCU,W

To arrive at the courthouse:  take the B, D and 4 subway lines to 161 St Yankee Stadium. You'll have a short walk to the courthouse.

Please note, many of us are wearing blue or cat imagery to show unity and stand out in the court room.

http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/bronx/bronx-man-serve-1-year-jail-beating-burning-cat-article-1.2504139

http://www.amny.com/news/ernesto-bailey-pleads-guilty-to-beating-burning-cat-to-death-in-bronx-1.11349087


#‎ErnestoBaileyCatKiller ‪#‎JusticeForKittyDoe
results.how_to_find_us: After passing the metal detectors in the court building, check alphabetically on the case list in the lobby for Bailey's name
results.name: The Sentencing of Cat Killer - Ernesto Bailey

results.description:
Hello! 

Our Premium Contributor Giuseppe Basile, CMT, swing trader and IFTA associate, will represent FXStreet at Traders Expo New York.

It is a special FXStreet Session and of course, a seminar free of charge. Save the date in your calendars: Monday, February 22, 2016, 11:15 am – 12:00 pm, Marriott Marquis Hotel


Trading Success by Modeling Modern Algos and with Automated Execution


Giuseppe Basile will demonstrate how relatively simple models can capture moves brought about by algorithms in modern markets. Algos affect prices of high-volume markets on all timeframes. Examples of the techniques to take advantage of their presence on indexes and forex pairs will also be presented. Giuseppe will conclude talking about risk parachutes

About Giuseppe Basile 

Giuseppe Basile, CMT, is a trader and mentor with over 15 years experience specializing in the effects of modern algorithms on price of forex and high volume futures and stocks. A member of the International Federation of Technical Analaysts (IFTA), he has published research papers on money management and trading objectives, high-frequency trading (HFT), algorithms and innovative trading and timing methods. He is founder of FibStalker Trading,FXStreet premium contributor, and presents at national and international events and trading shows. Mr. Basile’s novel and unique methods attempt to capture footprints of program trading and modern algos in high-volume markets using custom Fibonacci and proprietary timing techniques.

Very much looking forward to seeing you!

#FXStreetSessions


You can have more information in the following link: https://sessions.fxstreet.com/2016/02/11/save-the-date-and-meet-us-at-the-traders-expo-new-york-and-the-money-show-orlando/

Register free: http://www.newyorktradersexpo.com/company-details?acctid=7661&name=FXStreet


See you there!
results.name: Trading Success by Modeling Modern Algos and with Automated Execution

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.
results.name: New moms' discussion group
Jill's Mah Jong group

results.description:
CRS and Mar Creation, Inc. welcome a delegation from Fukushima University to report on the current situation in and around the site of the Fukushima nuclear disaster of 2011 and to present and discuss a three-part series of documentary films, 1/10 Ask Fukushima, made in 2013, 2014 and 2015 about the disaster. The first part will be screened with English subtitles on Monday, February 22 at 1 pm at CRS, with a discussion to follow.

A lengthier panel discussion will be held that evening at CRS from 7:15 pm.

Parts 2 and 3 of the film series will be shown at CRS on Feb 24 at 11 am and at 1:30 pm, respectively, unfortunately without English subtitles.

A suggested donation of $10 is asked to support each of the events.

1 pm: Screening a documentary feature “1/10 Listening to Fukushima 2013”

One of the Fukushima delegates visiting New York, Radio Fukushima announcer Arata Oowada, appeared in the documentary film “1/10 Listening to Fukushima 2013” directed by Yo Kohatsu. He documented the up-and-coming actress Miyuki Sato, who appeared NHK’s “Hanako and Anne” and “Yae no Sakura” as she returned to her hometown near the nuclear plants. The film is the first in a 10-part series of features that depicts the tedious cleanup and stories of those caught in the aftermath. The film is in Japanese with English subtitles.

7:15pm: The role of Media: How Media portray Fukushima and reported the Nuclear Accident, and Future of the Media

Information is essential for survival at a time of crisis. The wake of Arab Spring was the beginning of Social Media playing a central role in reporting; for Japan, it was the Great East Japan Earthquake. Simultaneously, the radio was the key source of news at evacuation centers when the Internet infrastructure failed. The talk/discussion will focus on media and their influence; how people engaged with media in the midst of the emergency, and the media impact on residents of Fukushima including “Damaged by Rumors.” The event will be held in Japanese with English translation.

Facilitator – Keiko Tsuyama, Journalist living in New York

Participants and discussion topic:

Arata Oowada, Radio Fukushima announcer – How Media reported on the nuclear accident

Hiroshi Kainuma, Associate Professor of Fukushima Univ. & FURE – The Media and Fukushima

Naoya Sekiya, Associate Professor of Tokyo Univ. - How Media reported on the nuclear accident & their influence on “Damage by Rumor”

Students of Ritsumeikan Univ in Kyoto – Approach to eat & support Fukushima at cafeteria

Yuri Oota, Translator
results.name: Screen & Discuss 1/10 Ask Fukushima (2013)

venue.name: New York City Council Committee Room

results.description:
The New York City Council Committee on Environmental Protection will hold a hearing on Int 446 in relation to banning the discharge, disposal, sale or use of fracking waste in New York City and Res 791 in relation to calling upon the General Electric Corporation and the United States Environmental Protection Agency to enter into an agreement that expands the scope of the Hudson River PCBs remediation plan.

While New York State currently banned high-volume horizontal hydraulic fracturing, we still have conventional vertical drilling oil and gas wells in New York State. In addition, Pennsylvania has been fracking thousands of wells and is projecting to frack thousands more. New York State’s Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) is permitting solid and liquid treatment facilities to accept Pennsylvania’s waste. DEC is also permitting conventional fracking waste from New York State for road spreading to suppress dust, to stabilize, and to de-ice. Since New York State legislature has not yet enacted any ban fracking waste legislation, New York City needs to pass a ban fracking waste bill to protect the residents of New York City. The most recent blizzard hitting New York City reminded us that none of us wanted to have toxic brine spread on the city’s roads as road salt which could pollute our water and air and harm the health of people living and working in New York City as well as the health of our pets. Think of all the dog owners walking their dogs in the snow and slush. Passage of Int. 446 will ensure that toxic oil and gas brine is never used on New York City roads.

Council member Steve Levin introduced Int 446 in 2014. It’s taken us working on this bill for two years to finally have a hearing scheduled. A hearing is a necessary step before any bill can be brought to the city council floor for a vote. We can also suggest changes to a bill at a hearing. We need to have a big turnout at the hearing and as many people testify as possible to show our city elected officials that we care about this bill and want this bill to pass. We hope that each of you would include the following two important changes we want in Int 446 in your testimony:

• Increase the penalty for non-compliance from the current $100 per violation to at least $25,000. (A $100 fine is not a deterrent. At least 11 counties in New York State have included a penalty provision in their fracking waste bans that provide for a fine up to $25,000 per violation.)

• Definition of waste should not be limited to only waste from natural gas extraction activities. It should include all relevant forms of oil and natural gas waste, including waste from oil and natural gas storage.

For more details please go to http://www.unitedforaction.org/ home page.
results.name: Attend NYC Council Hearing on Ban Fracking Waste Bill

results.description:
We anticipate the event will be extremely full with those already registered. If you're on the wait list, you can try to see if there's space at 6:30pm. Wait listed guests will need to remain outside the building while registered guests check-in.


Since humans first settled in cities thousands of years ago, technology has repeatedly revolutionized the way we live. Just in the last 200 years, steam, electricity and the automobile have radically changed the daily lives of city residents. We are now poised for a revolution based on digital technology that can improve quality of life and make cities more human-focused, while using scarce resources more efficiently. Sidewalk Labs will discuss the opportunities and challenges that they are taking on as they start up right here in New York City.

Sidewalk Labs Presenters:


Anand Babu

Anand is Chief Operating Officer for Sidewalk Labs.  He previously led efforts in Google's Special Projects team focused on cities and transportation and led product incubation within Google’s Machine Intelligence team.

Anand is originally from Peoria, Illinois and earned his B.S. in Electrical Engineering from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, MBA and M.S. in Engineering Management from Northwestern University / Kellogg School of Management. He lives with his wife and two sons in New York City, where he’s nurturing his kids’ interests in garbage trucks, trains, and maps.

Craig Nevill-Manning

Craig is Chief Technology Officer of  Sidewalk Labs, leading the engineering team – which focuses on developing new urban technologies – and working with portfolio companies to develop their engineering teams and technology. Before joining Sidewalk Labs, he founded Google's first remote engineering center, located in New York City. As a Director at Google New York, Craig worked on a broad array of impactful products. 

A native of New Zealand, he earned a BSc in Computer Science from Canterbury University and a PhD in Computer Science from Waikato University. Passionate about great coffee, he co-founded Happy Bones café in Little Italy with his wife Kirsten and partners from New Zealand.

We expect space to fill up quickly. You can typically catch talks once posted to our YouTube channel.


Open captions will be available at the event. Captions will also be live streamed to smartphones and web-enabled devices to follow along at the event.

_________________________________

The agenda for this event is:

5:30 - 6:30 pm: Attendees Register / Networking

6:30 - 7:15 pm: Welcome, Talks, Q&A

7:15 - 8:00 pm: Networking and Goodnight

Please note the venue entrance is on the 8th Avenue side of the building, and you should enter at the 8th Ave / 16 St corner. If you mistakenly go to the 9th Avenue entrance, building security will ask you to walk around the building (on the outside!) The A,C,E trains stop on the 8th Avenue side.

The RSVP name will be provided to building security in advance - so please register with your real name (first/last) as this will significantly speed up registration. Security requires you to show a form of identification at the time of check-in. If you require special accommodations, please let us (the organizers) know.

Google volunteers will also be present at the event to answer any questions you may have. Look for people wearing "Google" t-shirts.

See you there!
results.name: Sidewalk Labs: Reimagining the City as a Digital Platform

results.description:
The freelancing industry enjoyed impressive growth in the past several years. Freelancers make their own hours, they are their own bosses and they tend to be happier. It's such an exciting prospect but where do you start?

This talk is for anyone interested in freelancing at some point in their career. A lot of students earn money on the side by freelancing.

Asia Hoe (http://asiahoe.com/) is an NYC Product Designer specializing in UX Design, Visual Design, and Front-End Development. She has worked as a freelance UX, UI and Product Designer for many years throughout her career in different company locales - startup, agency, non-profit etc. While she is a designer, many of her insights can be applied to other professions and industries.
results.name: Becoming a Freelance Designer

results.description:
Route to be determined that day.  This is a fast paced workout, less of a social event due to the cooler temps and darkness, therefore will be limited in size. Everyone goes on the waitlist. Please read the event in it's entirety and respond to the questions asked when you rsvp.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 1 liter of water. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. You must feel comfortable hiking on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due to the nature of this event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. This is not mean, it is for your protection as well as the safety of the group. We will hike a minimum of 4 miles and 1200 EG. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any question.


Heavy rain may cancel and would be determined that day if necessary.

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

The hottest stand-up show in LA is now in NYC. The show is called Supply and Demand and was just featured by Time Out Los Angeles. In Los Angeles, most of the shows are sold out, and the show was featured on ESPN, when SportsNation's Michelle Beadle did a special surprise set. Past surprise guests include Howie Mandel, Jerrod Carmichael, Pete Holmes, and Whitney Cummings!

The show is normally $20, but we have $5 tickets for the group. INSTRUCTIONS YOU NEED TO FOLLOW!

1) RSVPing is not enough! To get the tickets, visit http://www.GothamComedyClub.com with the code MEETUPFIVE and follow the checkout instructions - you must do this BEFORE the day of the show.

2) When you arrive, go to the box office podium. Tell them you're there for the meetup and you already have tickets (and your name is on the list). It's a 7PM curtain, but we're meeting up early (at 6PM).

results.description:
After a great meetup this week, we're ready for the next one. 

• This will be a somewhat structured usability testing session in which the attendees are both participants (test takers) and hosts (test administrators). 

• We'll take turns of about 10-15 minutes each to use other member's products (websites, apps or hardware) and try to give honest feedback. Please be sure to bring your computer/tablet/phone with you so you can have others use your products.

• If you don't have a product of your own, but would like to become more comfortable with usability testing, you can use a website or an app that you like as your test product. Just bring your computer/tablet/phone with the website or application you would like to test.

• Everyone who attends should participate, so no observers. If you're bringing a team member with you, ideally you will both be testing your product separately and comparing notes later on.

Feel free to leave a comment or message me directly if you have any questions.

Looking forward to it!

results.description:
Join us for an insiders chat with Christina Rene from VOILA EVENT SOLUTIONS in this a lab for event aficionados on Sales and Strategies for Catering and Event Professionals. 

This lab will offer industry training to anyone new to the world of events or someone who needs a little refresher on client acquisition & retention. This will be a sneak peak to a 3 week long intensive offered at NYU in April by Christina Rene.

From destination management to event production, Christina Rene is a rainmaking event professional, whose career spans 10 years, 4 industries and a plethora of high-end brands. Starting her career in destination management, Christina worked on prominent corporate events for clients that included Citigroup and Nelson Mandela’s Peace Parks Foundation. Christina has also worked on the more personal side of event planning…weddings. Through countless weddings, Christina served as wedding planner and lead bridal liaison for a wedding planning and design firm, where she learned to master the “psyche of a bride”, and anticipate needs before ever said. 

Four years later, Christina shifted her sights to boutique hotels, and joined the team at Morgans Hotel Group where she managed onsite corporate and high profile events for Facebook, Morgan Stanley, The Colbert Report and G-Star, among others. Now running two of her own agencies, Christina is just getting started. She is the Owner and Creative Director of Voilà Event Solutions - a full-service events and hospitality provider offering sales and management consulting, as well as event production and design. In February 2015, alongside her business partner, she launched Space In The Raw, an innovative real estate platform for pop-up events, turning New York's vacant spaces into brilliant visions.

_______________________________________________________________________

At PUNTO, we know it's especially important to have creative resources, camaraderie within your creative community and the ability to collaborate in a space that embraces who you are! 


ALL event professionals welcome! 


*To attend this FREE MeetUp, you must RSVP and join the PUNTO Events & Performance MeetUp group. *Please note attendees may be photographed.

Been here before and need events and performance space? Here's the link! 

New to PUNTO? We'd love to show off our space! Take a look at Studio A, B, C, and D while you're here! Venue ratings welcome HERE!

Dear friends,

Thank you for making our weekly Social Monday's a great success.

Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to socialize, and make new friends.

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members: you guys rock!Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes.

Come and get rewards by: 

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Playing our games

None of which are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH MONDAY'S/SOCIAL MONDAY'S/ (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last events

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

Join our host, Justin Herman, as he welcomes comics: Mike Vincent, Jackie Peters, Louis Bee, Gary Levitt, Heather Apostolidis, Ronnie Fleming, James Camacho, Mark Helfgott, Alex Csedrik, Lauren Boulay, Andrew Tavin, Paola Dater & April Perry.

NYC
6pm

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

group.name: Free and Affordable Yoga, Meditation, African Dance Classes

www.nyeek.com

Facebook Page : Twitter

Nyeek Drinks are our game nights at Amity Hall. They're pretty regular, but always check the listings before coming in case we have to cancel or change dates.

Most of the places we play at don't charge us a rental fee. So please keep in mind not to bring outside food or drink, to purchase something from the establishment and to be respectful of the space in general.

There is a game night special that runs from 5 PM to 11 PM for people playing games. In addition to $5.00 drafts on select beers it is also $10.00 for sliders, wings, chicken strips, nachos or traditional pizza. Please note that it $10.00 for the individual items, not for all five.

results.description:
**There are 100 people signed up for the league who are there every night REGARDLESS of who is signed up from Meetup - so don't worry about how many people have RSVP'ed just here on Meetup.  We just leave up the Meetup for any new people (that's you!) who would want to come join us.  There are ALWAYS a ton of people.** 

Who: Exactly 1 buttload of good people
What: FREE Dodgeball!
Where: Manhattan, West Village, St Luke School, 487 Hudson St
Why: Fun n stuff
How: read below...

Oh hi there person reading this.  My name's Ari.  You should come play dodgeball with us.  That's a fun game.  Remember that from grade school?  Yeah, apparently when you're an adult you're still allowed to do that.  Who knew?  Oh, and now we get to go to a bar afterward instead of back to math class.  So there's that.  Adulthood has its perks.

See, here's some photos of shenanigans:

Doesn't that look like those people are having good times?  That could be you having good times!  You're a people!  And good times are the best kinds of times.

---

FAQ

SO WHO ARE YOU?
So the deal is that we're the group in NYC that gets together to play dodgeball every week...because we are overgrown children.  Sometimes old school rubber playground balls, sometimes little soft jello ones, sometimes some foam ones.  We're not here to F you.  That's why it's FREE for new folk.    But we're more a community than anything (but how legit does our website look?!) and just a good group of people running around with a childhood sport...and then, you know, a bar after if that's your thing.  

I WANT IN!  BUT WHAT IF I'M BAD/SCARED?
We don't just throw you to wolves - we'll introduce you around, explain everything, and no experience or athleticism necessary!  No one's gonna bully you or not want to play/hang out with you for being "bad" - no one cares about that...that's what a dick would do.  And we're not dicks.


WHAT IF I'M LATE?
It's just dodgeball, relax.  Come and go as you please.  The earlier you get there, the more you play of course, but no worries.

WHAT ABOUT MY STUFF? WHAT DO I WEAR?
There are bathrooms to change in if you need to.  Everyone leaves their stuff by the side of the court.  Plenty come straight from work.  Whatever you'd want to run around in is cool for clothes.  You wanna come in your work suit?  Rock on.

THIS IS AWESOME.  IS THERE A LEAGUE?!  I WANT MORE!

There is a full league that goes on too, if you're interested.  Same deal - good or bad all welcome!  More formal with teams and schedules and trophies and costume themes and karaoke and drink deals and all... More info here: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com/register , but any questions just lemme know!

Any questions, don't hesitate!  We'll get back to you! 

facebook.com/groups/NYCDodgeball
www.sandlotsportsnyc.com


A firm embrace,
Ari

<a href="http://www.sandlotsportsnyc.com"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: www.sandlotsportsnyc.com
results.name: FREE Coed Dodgeball & Bar Party! West Village - Old School Rubber Balls

results.description:
MONDAY NIGHTS, TAROT SALON WITH THE TAROT SCHOOL

Click HERE to register with Tarot Salon directly

Forest Hills, 6-9:30pm, 

includes delicious light dinner and dessert!

$20 Pre-register online or cash, check, card at the door 

RSVP REQUIRED TO THE TAROT SCHOOL because space is limited!

(also RSVP here at Meetup, please!)

THERE IS ONLY ROOM FOR 15 PEOPLE!

LOCATION PROVIDED WHEN YOU CONTACT THEM.

Click HERE to register with Tarot Salon directly

or[masked] or  http://www.tarotschool.com/Classes.html

Every week, The Tarot School in Forest Hills offers a valuable, interactive Tarot class in the home of the founders, Ruth Ann & Wald Amberstone. Intimate, playful, and loaded with great new techniques and knowledge-based Tarot details, each class gives attendees a chance to both learn and practice.

This Meetup can only hold 14 people, and is held in a private home, so:

1st ~  Click this link http://www.tarotschool.com/Classes.html
and RSVP to The Tarot School, to receive your email about location

2nd ~ RSVP here at Living Tarot Meetup so that others will know you are coming. More's the merrier!

I look forward to seeing you in Forest Hills 

to throw the cards,  learn lots, and make new friends!

Warmly, 

Ferol

http://www.ferolhumphrey.com
results.how_to_find_us: This event takes place near Jewel Avenue & Yellowstone Blvd in the heart of Forest Hills, in a private home.  You must contact the Amberstones  in order to attend.  800-804-2184 or Tarot@Tarotschool.com
results.name: The Tarot School's Tarot Salon, Forest Hills NY~ Different every week!

results.description:
Free admission, no reservations required

Please join us for this talk by Professor Franco Mormando of Boston College, which opens the Bernini in Paris series. Sculptor, architect, painter, playwright, and scenographer, Gian Lorenzo Bernini [masked]) was the last of the universal geniuses of early modern Italy, placed by both contemporaries and posterity in the same exalted company as Leonardo, Raphael, and Michelangelo. Bernini's artistic vision remains palpably present today through the countless statues, fountains, buildings and other works of his design that transformed Rome into the splendid Baroque theater that continues to enthrall in our own time.

In his lecture Franco Mormando, author of the first English-language biography of the artist, will give us a guided tour of Bernini's long, dramatic life (private and public) and his equally fascinating Rome, with special emphasis on his many (and troubled) interactions with the French court.

**********
Franco Mormando is Professor of Italian and chairperson of the Dept. of Romance Languages and Literatures at Boston College, where he has taught since 1994. Born and raised in Manhattan, he did his undergraduate degree (B.A.) at Columbia University. His two graduate degrees in Italian (M.A. and Ph.D.) are from Harvard University. He holds as well a licentiate (Master’s degree) in church history from the Jesuit School of Theology in Berkeley, having also completed the Biennio di Filosofia program at the Gregorian University in Rome.

In 1999 he was principal curator and catalogue editor of the Boston Caravaggio exhibition, Saints and Sinners: Caravaggio and the Baroque Image. He was also originator and co-curator of the 2005 exhibition at the Worcester Art Museum entitled Hope and Healing: Painting in Italy in a Time of Plague,[masked] and edited a companion volume entitled, Piety and Plague in Europe: From Byzantium to the Baroque, published in 2007.

His book, The Preacher’s Demons: Bernardino of Siena and the Social Underworld of Early Renaissance Italy, was published in 1999 by the University of Chicago Press and awarded the Howard Marraro Prize for Excellence in Italian historical scholarship by the American Catholic Historical Association.

Author of various interdisciplinary articles on Italian literature and history, popular religion and sermons, he has lectured extensively on the religious art and culture of early modern Italy at various universities and museums including the Metropolitan Museum, the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, and the National Gallery of Art, Washington, DC. The focus of his current research and writing is the Italian Baroque artist, Gian Lorenzo Bernini. His extensively annotated English translation and critical edition of Domenico Bernini’s Life of Gian Lorenzo Bernini was published in Spring 2011 by Penn State University Press. Published in October 2011 by the University of Chicago Press was his own biography of Bernini entitled, Bernini: His Life and His Rome, and representing the first English-language account of the artist’s private life and public career. He is currently at work on another Bernini volume entitled, Bernini on Stage: The Artist as Playwright, Director, Actor and Scenographer.

He has given many presentations for the general public on his Bernini: His Life and His Rome, in various venues, including the Kimbell Museum of Art (Ft. Worth, TX), the Phoenix Art Museum, the Istituto Italiano di Cultura (San Francisco), the Italian Embassy in Washington, DC., Harvard and Yale University.

In September 2005, in recognition of his achievements in the promotion of the Italian language and culture, he was inducted by the Republic of Italy into its honorary Ordine della Stella della Solidarietà Italiana with the title of “Cavaliere.”

http://www.francomormando.com/
http://www.bc.edu/schools/cas/romlang/faculty-staff/mormando.html

results.description:
I checked out the Jan spotlight and it was a great way to spend a Mon night. So great news: there's another one set for Feb!

Link:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/good-food-spotlight-a-pitch-workshop-by-foodstand-and-slow-money-nyc-february-tickets-21045279999?aff=erelexpmlt

Here are details - I will be unable to make it but enjoy!

show less
**Please order ticket through EVENTBRITE through this link.**

Join Foodstand and Slow Money NYC, for an evening of drinks and collaborative thinking, as we invite entrepreneurs, creators and innovators in the food space for an opportunity to showcase their product or business to a diverse panel of experts and audience collaborators who’ve all shown up with one mission: To help good food ventures be the best they can be. </a> (All Foodstand members on app get in for free. All you need to do is download the free app <a href="http://www.thefoodstand.com/download">here and all notification comes through Monday's email)

6:00PM: Coaching Office Hours + Doors Open 7:00PM: Community Announcements + Alumni Keynote + Introductions

7:10PM: Spotlight Presentations by 4-5 Entrepreneurs in which:

• Entrepreneur presents an idea, product, challenge or service for 4 minutes. • 3+ Experts give feedback & ask questions in the next 4 minutes. • Audience votes on live-text questions submitted by the Entrepreneur.

8:15PM: Drinks and Networking for All with Entrepreneurs, Creators, Innovators. Here's the lowdown:

You arrive and meet, mingle, try samples, learn about entrepreneurs to be in spotlight that evening | Meet the panelists and then hear the 4MIN pitch per entrepreneur | Participate in voting and sharing your thoughts | Then have a chance to meet entrepreneurs and chat with other guests | $10 if you use code FOODSTANDFRIEND - will include link once it's set up on their site.

You can also check out Foodstand's app by downloading it.

Note: while it shows as a private residence this was the only way address could be shown via meetup.
results.name: FOODSTAND Spotlight:,Food Entrepreneur Pitch Night

group.name: NYC Food Festivals and Events Group

results.description:
What does it take to build a high growth SaaS sales engine?  Does it come down to hiring?  Is it finding that repeatable process?  Where does the "sales stack" come into play?

Our panel of NYC SaaS sales leaders will share their experiences in building out the infrastructure of people, process, and technology for their companies and what lessons they learned along the way.

On our panel, we have:

• Bryan Caplin, GM & Head of Sales at Axiom Law

• Annie Stancliffe, Gallery Partnerships Director at Artsy

• Max Appelbaum, SVP, Sales & Accounts at Shoptiques

We look forward to seeing you at our studio at Livesteam for networking, great content, and sharing with a crowd of SaaS sales peers.

MORE ABOUT OUR PANELISTS

Annie Stancliffe was an early team member at Artsy, starting out doing art-historical research for the Art Genome Project and transitioning into client-facing work with Artsy's gallery partners. When Artsy made the transition to a subscription-based model in 2013, Annie made the first sales call and has been leading and scaling the sales organization ever since. Before Artsy, Annie studied Art History at UPenn and worked at the Foundation for Contemporary Arts and the Denver Art Museum. She originally hails from Boulder, CO and is a lifelong skier, hiker, and runner. 


Bryan Caplin is the Northeast GM and Head of Sales, at Axiom Law (www.axiomlaw.com).  Axiom, the world’s largest alternative provider of technology-enabled legal solutions, supports 90% of the Fortune 500 across 3 continents and 15 locations.  In his current role, Bryan oversees the New York & Boston operations, including a team of 30+ inside & outside sales executives on the East Coast, in pursuit of a $70MM target.  Prior to joining Axiom in London, where he helped launch that market, Bryan spent 10 years at CEB (formerly the Corporate Executive Board), in a variety of sales leadership roles in both the US and the UK.  A native New Yorker (and Brooklyn resident), doomed Jets/Mets fan, and proud father of two, Bryan holds an MBA from NYU Stern and a BA from the University of Virginia. 

Max Appelbaum leads sales and acccount services for Shoptiques.com, an online fashion marketplace that aggregates inventory of participating local boutiques from across the US. Before that, he was a sales leader at SinglePlatform, responsible for performance of direct sales team through leadership of 8 sales managers who oversee 70+ inside sales reps where he set goals, strategy, hiring, training and team building for the local sales team.
results.name: How to Supercharge Your SaaS Sales

results.description:
GDI is partnering with Sailthru to offer members the opportunity to code together in a relaxed environment and to participate in a code review session with a Engineer from Sailthru.

Whether you're just getting started with programming, or have been at it for awhile, this will be a comfy space to work on a project alongside other folks and maybe make a few friends.

You also have the opportunity to sign up for a 40 minute code review with a member of the Sailthru dev team. Code reviews are one of the most common aspects of working on software teams and they help you clarify how you think about your code. This is a great chance to get used to this practice in a supportive environment.

This event is limited to 10 participants to make sure there is equitable time spent with every person requesting a code review to meet with a professional developer. 

Volunteer developers from Sailthru have expertise in the following fields: 

1 developer in iOS, 1 developer in Data Science, 2 back end developers (language agnostic) 

Important Information:

• Participation is limited so each attendee can have ample time for mentorship

• Code review sessions with Engineers will be 40 minutes each

• If you're requesting a code review, the following information is needed to complete your registration:

-- > the GitHub repo of the codebase you'd like to review

-->  how long you've been programming

Your mentor and time slot will be communicated upon arrival.

A $10 donation toward the Girl Develop It scholarship fund is requested to confirm your attendance.

______________________________________________

Event Schedule

6:00 - 6:45 Doors open, say hi, grab a drink or a snack
6:45 - 7:30 First code review session. (All attendees not in code reviews can socialize or work in the coffee bar)
7:30 - 7:45 Break
7:45 - 8:30 Second code review session
results.name: Co-working & Code Review

results.description:
We'll join the Schomburg Center and lead actor Forest Whitaker who'll discuss his Broadway debut in conversation with director and Tony Award-winner Michael Grandage and other members of the cast and creative team.


Play synopsis: Hughie is set in the lobby of a small midtown hotel on the West Side of Manhattan where Erie Smith, a drunken, small time hustler, is mourning the recent death of the hotel’s night clerk, Hughie. Erie regales the new night clerk with tall tales of his glory days spent with Hughie.

Our Meetup


The group will meet Daniel at the Schomburg Center at 6:00pm, seating for the event will likely start around 6:30pm, with the start of the event at 7:00pm. IF YOU RSVP TO ATTEND, PLEASE TRY NOT TO BE LATE AND CHECK THE NOTIFICATIONS SECTION THE DAY OF FOR ANY POSSIBLE CHANGES/ANNOUCEMENTS. The event will fill to capacity and we'll need to gain entrance together as a group. If you arrive after the group has entered, there will be no way to guarantee entry or seating.


As always, if you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, please give Daniel a call/text to 774.275.3646.

Directions to The Schomburg Center:

Train: Take the #2 or #3 trains to 135th Street. The Schomburg entrance is between 135th & 136 streets, on Malcom X Blvd. (Lenox Avenue).
Bus: Catch either the M7 or M102 to 135th Street and Malcolm X Blvd.

About The Schomburg Center

The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, a research unit of The New York Public Library, is generally recognized as one of the leading institutions of its kind in the world. For over 80 years the Center has collected, preserved, and provided access to materials documenting black life, and promoted the study and interpretation of the history and culture of peoples of African descent.
results.name: Theater Talks @ The Schomburg Center: Forest Whitaker in "Hughie"

results.description:
Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
Chip Parmele 

Charles “Chip” Parmele will tell us how to raise early stage financing.  Chip is a Limited Partner in six venture capital Limited Partnerships and a strategic insurance advisor to approximately fifty others.  He is a Mentor to the Entrepreneurs Roundtable Accelerator (ERA), an early stage seed fund and technology accelerator.  He is a Charter Member of the Indus Entrepreneurs (TiE), a global network of entrepreneurs and professionals established to foster entrepreneurship.  He is also a Founder of teq.Konnect, an invitation only networking group for technology companies in the Mid-Atlantic region.  Along with his brother, Jim, they spend much of their time advising in the technology sector.  Join us and learn about early stage financing from Chip!

Agenda for the evening is as follows:


6:30 to 7:00 Pizza & Networking


7:00 to 7:10 Updates

7:10 to 7:20 Audience/Member Announcements and Requests

7:20 to 7:30 Startup Pitch #1


7:40 to 7:50 Startup Pitch #2


7:50 to 8:30 Keynote speaker: Chip Parmele

After 9:00   Drinks at Vanderbilt's in the Hamilton Park Hotel https://maps.google.com/maps?expflags%3Denable_star_based_justifications:true%26ie%3DUTF8%26cid%3D16356950445471689601%26q%3DHamilton%2BPark%2BHotel%2B%2526%2BConference%2BCenter%26iwloc%3DA%26gl%3DUS%26hl%3Den">175 Park Ave Florham Park, NJ 07932 - Just exit through the Florham Road / Park Ave exit of FDU and you will see the Hotel on the left before you reach Park Ave.

results.description:
NOTE: HUI Central™ is our new name (formerly NUI Central).

6:30PM - 7:00PM - Networking

7:00PM - 8:00PM -

Humanized User Interface - What It Is and Why You Need To Know About It

We're kicking off 2016 (our 4th year!) with a new name and an event that takes a deep dive into Humanized User Interface™ or (HUI™) - a more accurate description of the technologies typically called NUI. So, this presentation will explore the amazing advancements available today, that can enable apps and devices to interact with us like we do with other people. We'll help attendees to understand the difference between NUI and HUI, what exactly HUI is, where it's headed, how to best use it in projects and products, how to create amazing HUI based user experiences, and touch on some of the array of API's available right now.

HUI™ is the cusp of a shift in UI/UX that every major tech company is investing in and rolling out and a stream of new start-ups are developing API's, devices, and services around. There's no more crucial time for you to grow your knowledge of this than now!

Presented by HUI Central Organizers:


Deb Benkler and Ken Lonyai are well known as New York's HUI™ (and NUI) evangelists. They are co-founders of the planet's largest HUI community, HUI Central™ and have worked closely with Microsoft and IBM, managing really cool HUI oriented hackathons including the NUI Central Watson Hackathon and NUI Central Kinect for Windows Hackathon 2015.

In 2016, the pair are leveraging their expertise by launching a dev studio/consultancy called humanize™, to guide brands in the development of apps/products/services that utilize HUI to deliver more meaningful and engaging user experiences to their customers.

The two were at the helm when ScreenPlay InterActive received a 2012 User Experience Award (a UXie) as well as the company's creation of a bunch of leading edge technologies that utilize all five senses interactively.

8:00PM - 8:30PM - Hang Out - Network

Share this event:   @HUICentral

Join HUI Central.com

IMPORTANT : If you come to the event and you are not registered on the Meetup site by 3:00PM on the day of the Meetup, you will have to wait to the side to see if there's room to accommodate you. If so, you will have to pay $10 to be admitted, else you will have to leave.

CODE OF CONDUCT

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

Humanized User Interface, HUI, and HUI Central are trademarks of ScreenPlay InterActive Corp.

results.description:
Dear Dharma Drink Friends,

Metta - Loving Kindness


Come join us for a delicious vegetarian dinner at Saravana Bhavan.  Our topic for this dinner will be Metta / Loving Kindness and Compassion.

While the words “Loving Kindness” and “Compassion” are common words in our daily vocabulary and we probably feel we know or kind of know what they mean, Buddha taught loving-kindness / loving-friendliness, or metta.  From commentaries on the Lotus Sutra, “loving-kindness and compassion are the uprooting of suffering and the creation of joy.”  Loving-kindness and compassion are the basis for generosity and teaching the Dharma.  Through this practitioners or bodhisattvas practice to alleviate suffering.  Also note that loving-kindness and compassion is not the exclusive property of Buddhists as all sentient being possess them.

Don’t mistake loving kindness and compassion as turning to the other cheek.  If the truth and justice are slandered, standing up to protect them is a form of courage and is a form of loving-kindness and compassion.  Thus loving-kindness & compassion require wisdom.  The Great Techniques of Stopping Delusion and Seeing Truth: “Wisdom is loving kindness and compassion...  have loving-kindness and compassion for all sentient beings and give charity without expecting anything in return…  to uproot suffering and give happiness.”

However sometimes there is an overindulgence of loving-kindness and compassion and becomes forgiving the misdeeds of others creating a warm bed of misdoings.  The proper medicine of loving-kindness and compassion may not always be the kind or overly kind actions.

How does one apply loving-kindness and compassion then?  One method explained is as follow: Knowing ourselves and others.  Understand ourselves, our emotions, and dealing with our internal issues and vexations so what we can gain wisdom.  Then we can begin to understand others, develop empathy, compassion and loving-kindness to others, who have their own vexations.

Join us for an evening of discussion as we share our thoughts and experiences on the topic of loving-kindness and compassion to others, and also to oneself.

We've only reserve a certain section of the restaurant and may be seated with the general patrons.  If you come on time, then we can try to all sit together at neighboring tables so that we can easily chat with one another.


Note: we are here to share and provide others with opportunity to speak.  Also we need to be cognizant not to preach or solicit.  

Look forward to meeting everyone,

_/|\_

Eddie

References:

“Facets of Metta” by Sharon Salzberg

http://www.vipassana.com/meditation/facets_of_metta.php

“Loving Ourselves by Looking Deeply Into Ourselves” by Thich Nhat Hanh

http://mettarefuge.wordpress.com/2010/10/25/thich-nhat-hanh-on-loving-ourselves-by-looking-deeply-into-ourselves/

“Humanisti Buddhism, A Blueprint for Life” by Venerable Master Hsing Yun

“Zen & Inner Peace, Volume One” by Chan Master Shen Yen
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the inside room.
results.name: Dinner & Discussion: Loving Kindness & Compassion
