results.description:
You don’t need a team to reap the benefits of agile. Learn to apply some of the most powerful agile methodologies to your everyday work.


Are you intrigued by the benefits that agile techniques can bring to your work, but you work alone? Or do you want to become more productive in your individual role, but you work for an organization that has yet to embrace agile? This course will show you how to apply some of the most powerful agile techniques to your everyday work either as an individual or as a member of a traditional team. You’ll learn how to maximize your daily effort on the tasks that matter the most, better understand how much you can really finish during the day, and create a sustainable cadence in which your work will fit. And, you’ll learn to do this both at the small scale and the large scale, all while building a great product of your very own.

About the Author: Jeremy Jarrell is a software developer specializing in commercial application development for the enterprise space. He is heavily involved in the local developer community, both as a highly rated speaker throughout the east coast as well as a syndicated author whose articles have appeared on sites such as Simple-Talk.com and DZone.com. Jeremy's areas of specialization include agile development methodologies, team leadership, distributed architecture and web application security. He current resides in north central West Virginia with his wife and son and is an avid runner.
results.name: Agile for One Week 1 of 2

This is Dr.Schneider's "Orbital Mechanics Workshop. Dr.Schneider has been 30+ years in the outer space military defense industry and is now offering a 2.5 hour workshop on "Orbital Mech" a NewSpace NYC Workshop. Topics covered will include:

• All common satellite orbits, how they look, their functions and what industry uses them for today.

results.description:
Video has become, hands down, the most effective way to get seen and heard. In a nutshell, video marketing is where it's at. Without it, you're getting overlooked. You will not rank in search results which means that clients aren't finding you, you're not growing your income and you’re not making the impact in the world the way you are meant to. The solution is simple: catch your brilliance on film, and you'll get found, seen and hired. In this workshop, Catherine will provide tips on some of the most effective ways to share your brilliance on video in order to build your business. She will conduct interactive exercises to help you understand and define the passion behind what you do; a necessary but often ignored step towards making a video that is both unique to you and emotionally impactful with your audience. Bio:
Catherine Stratton is an award-winning filmmaker and the owner of Stratton Films, a Hoboken-based production company specializing in online marketing videos for creative individuals and entrepreneurs.
results.name: Show Your Story, Build Your Business

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 25 members will be attending! 

Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other, and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE (Space is limited).

*GET TICKET HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Feb-22-2016_at_0630PM

*$35-$45, price goes up as the event date gets closer. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets not sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

Get Tickets At This Link (no door sales) -  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Feb-22-2016_at_0630PM

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, no experience is necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Feb-22-2016_at_0630PM

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

The evening will begin promptly at 6:30 pm for newcomers and 7:30 pm for everyone else. Please be punctual and check-in prior to start in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Community Circling Practice Night will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below

Feb 29 - Community Circling Night 7:30- 10:30 EVERYONE

March 7 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
March 14 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
March 21 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
March 28 - Community Circling Night 7:30-10:30 EVERYONE

What’s it like to experience Circling?

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

Feb 29 - Community Circling Night 7:30- 10:30 EVERYONE

March 7 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
March 14 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
March 21 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
March 28 - Community Circling Night 7:30-10:30 EVERYONE

-------

Join Foodstand and Slow Money NYC, for an evening of drinks and collaborative thinking. Good Food Spotlight is a monthly event series designed to provide entrepreneurs in the food space with a unique opportunity to showcase their product or business and receive instant feedback from a diverse panel of experts and audience collaborators.

Good Food Spotlight empowers consumers to re-shape the food economy, fulfilling our mission: To help good food ventures be the best they can be.

Please order tickets through EventBrite

6:00PM: Coaching Office Hours + Doors Open 

7:00PM: Community Announcements + Alumni Keynote + Introductions

7:10PM: Spotlight Presentations by 4-5 Entrepreneurs in which:

• Entrepreneur presents an idea, product, challenge or service for  4 minutes. 

• 3+ Experts give feedback & ask questions in the next 4 minutes. 

• Audience votes on live-text questions submitted by the Entrepreneur.

8:15PM: Drinks and Networking for All with Entrepreneurs, Creators, Innovators

Have a food or drink business that you're working on? 

Inspired by Slow Money Principles? 

Have an existing local shop or online food venture that you want feedback on? 

Have some questions you want audience of food-lovers and experts to weigh in on?

results.description:
Michael conducts a lively, fun, and supportive class atmosphere. He has a talent for recognizing and strengthening varying student abilities within the class while giving individual attention in such a manner that the group benefits. Michael has many years of experience as an instructor of the extensive rhythms of Guinea. He provides a learning experience that is structured, knowledgeable, and entertaining! Classes cover the rhythms of Guinea along with the history, cultural significance, and traditions of the music and its people.

Michael’s classes, great for the absolute beginner, cover one West African rhythm per month. Class content includes development of correct sounds and technique, learning accompaniment patterns, and understanding subdivisions of simple West African rhythms.
results.name: Djembe/West African Drumming Class with Michael Markus

Please register for this class here:


http://civicrm.fatcatfablab.org/civicrm/event/register?reset=1&id=30 

This is a 2 part class covering the ins and out of using Adobe illustrator for laser cutting. We recommend you take this course prior to the Intro to the Laser Cutter course.

Class begins at 6:30 pm, feel free to come earlier to check out the lab.

$30 fee each class.

**You must bring a laptop with Illustrator already downloaded to the class**

Illustrator for Laser Cutting Part 1: INTRO TO ILLUSTRATOR- 6:30-8:30PM

In this class you will learn your way around Illustrator. For those who have never used Illustrator before, or have only very minimal Illustrator experience, this course will familiarize you with all of Illustrator's most useful features. You will learn how to create basic shapes, and use those shapes as building blocks to creating more elaborate shapes.This is a two part class, which will repeat next Wednesday at the same time.

About the Instructor:

Kathleen Kralowec started using Illustrator in 2005 and has since used the Illustrator for game design, UI, logo design, illustration, and for the creation of jewelry and stamps for the laser cutter. She has a Masters of Fine Art in Digital Arts & New Media from UC Santa Cruz and currently resides in New York.
results.how_to_find_us: Between West 10 St., due West of Seventh Avenue on W4 ST.
results.name: Design for the laser - Adobe Illustrator Part 1

results.description:
Lecture: Dan Rhatigan looks at the Letraset brand of rub-down type and other graphic supplies, showing how they put the tools of professional design into everyday hands. It will also look at how people had to improvise with Letraset, and make the most of the materials at hand
Letraset and other brands of rub-down type literally put typography in the hands of the people. Rub-down type made it possible for students, professionals, and everyone else to design with real typefaces, without needing professional typesetting services. A cheap and easy way to experiment with typography and other graphic elements, Letraset put a lot of care into making type easy to use well, but it also resulted in a lot of ways to use type badly, but with interesting results. With some care and attention, however, it was a great way to develop an eye for typography.

Dan Rhatigan worked as a designer and typographer for 15 years in Boston and New York before moving to England in 2006 for graduate school at the University of Reading. After receiving his MA in Typeface Design, he spent seven years working with Monotype as researcher, type designer, and eventually Type Director. He now lives in New York City again, where he works as an independent type designer and consultant
Free, but registration required:[masked]
results.name: Learning from Letraset

results.description:
The Functional Programmer’s Starter Kit takes anyone with an understanding of Object Oriented to competency and towards mastery with Functional Programming. We take a codebase and analyze how we can make it more Functional with concepts like functional composition, immutable data structures and promises. 

Speaker Garreth Dottin is a full stack engineer at TD Securities working in React, Angular, and Java. He graduated from Dev Bootcamp San Francisco. When he’s not reading about functional concepts, you can find him illustrating/ doodling in Central Park.
results.name: FPSK: From Object Oriented to Functional Programming

venue.name: Rosicrucian Cultural Center of New York City

results.description:
Last Rosicrucian New Year saw the inauguration of the Alchemy Exhibit at the Rosicrucian Egyptian Museum in San Jose, which forms the kernel of what will be the first Alchemy Museum in the United States and the largest Alchemy Museum in the world. 

During these evenings at the Rosicrucian Cultural Center of NYC, we will explore the processes and concepts of Alchemy on the physical and spiritual levels, using the images, documents and meditations from this ground-breaking exhibit, which was curated by Frater Dennis Hauck, Ph.D. 

As Rosicrucians, Alchemy in both its spiritual and physical aspects plays a critical role in our tradition, and we will delve into this through sight, word, and sound. 

The discussions will take place from 6:30 pm to 7:30 pm Monday through Thursday evenings.

Facilitator:

Frater Steven A. Armstrong, M.A. Hum., M.A., M.Div. is a professional historian, philosopher, and teacher based in the San Francisco Bay Area. He currently serves at the Grand Lodge (San Jose) in Membership Services. He is an active member of both the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC and the Traditional Martinist Order and has served as an officer in both Orders. 

His current areas of interest include how the Primordial Tradition permeates all world traditions, and the way in which the Rosicrucian and Martinist Paths provide a unique and unifying viewpoint on those traditions. 

Author of more than 30 published papers, articles and podcasts, and a lecturer for the RCUI, he is no stranger to NYC as he received two of his Master's Degrees at Fordham's Rose Hill Campus, and did his undergraduate work just north of New York at Yale.
results.name: Learn about Spiritual Alchemy

Myles Little (b. 1984, Ireland) is a senior photo editor at TIME Magazine. Based in New York City, The Huffington Post called him "a rising leader and visionary in the industry”. He studied photography at the Savannah College of Art and Design and has gone on to produce award-winning covers and features with many of the best photographers in the world. Outside of work, Myles curates photographed exhibits and lectures on photography internationally.

Join Myles as he speaks about the origins of his project, thought process behind his photo choices, the 15-venue world tour, the process of making a book with one of the best publishers in the world, and some truly crazy statistics about inequality!

results.description:
Inscrivez-vous pour une soirée culturelle fort intéressante.

CONFERENCE (en français)  sur l'écrivain  HOUELLEBECQ ! 

Prix groupe : $10 par personne (au lieu de $15). Veuillez s.v.p. m'envoyer votre chèque jusqu'au  l7 février au plus tard. Vous trouverez mon adresse lorsque vous vous inscrirez.

Description en français et anglais:

Michel Houellebecq: est-il actuellement en France notre contemporain capital?

par Jeanine Parisier Plottel, Professer Emerita in French Literature

 Le succès populaire de Michel Houellebecq le range parmi les successeurs de Victor Hugo, et plus proche de nous d‘André Gide et de Jean-Paul Sartre. C’est ainsi que les éditions Flammarion viennent de publier le premier volume de ses Oeuvres complètes, un an presque jour pour jour après les attentats contre Charlie Hebdo et la publication de Soumission, romanqui fait partie du palmarès 2016 des meilleures ventes de livres. Notre conférence examinera brièvement la vie et l’œuvre de notre contemporain capital et analysera plus en détail, Soumission. La lecture sera en français à l’Alliance Française in White Plains.

------------------------------------------

 Michel Houellebecq:  Is He Right Now in France Our Preeminent Contemporary?

by Jeanine Parisier Plottel, Professor Emerita in French Literature

 The popular success of Michel Houellebecq ranks him among the successors to Victor Hugo and, closer to our time, to André Gide and Jean-Paul Sartre. This is why the publisher Flammarion has just released the first volume of Hoellebecq’s Oeuvre completes(Complete Works), almost exactly one year after the attacks on Charlie Hebdo and the publication of Soumission (Submission), the novel that appeared on the 2016 prize lists for the best book sales.  Our talk will briefly examine the life and work of our preeminent contemporarywriter and analyze Soumission in greater detail.  Lecture will be in French at the Alliance Française in White Plains.

De son vrai nom Michel Thomas. Né à la Réunion en février 1958. A 6 ans, il est confié à sa grand'mère paternelle, dont il adoptera le nom Houellebecq comme nom de plume. Interne au lycée Henri Moissan de Meaux, ses camarades le surnommaient « Einstein » en vertu de ses capacités d’analyse et d’argumentation.

Quelques livres : La Poursuite du bonheur, qui obtient le prix Tristan Tzara. Maurice Nadeau publie en 1994 Extension du domaine de la lutte, puis en 1998 paraît Les Particules élémentaires chez Flammarion, suivi de Lanzarote en 2000, de La Possibilité d’une île en 2005 (Prix Interallié 2005) et de La Carte et le territoire couronné par le prix Goncourt en 2010.  Depuis son livre Les Particules élémentaires (1998) Michel Houellebecq domine la scène littéraire française.  Son dernier livre : Soumission apparu en 2015 a provoqué une polémique, même avant sa sortie.

results.description:
Hi everyone!

This week we will read Maggie Nelson & Italo Calvino, as recommended by our members Esme and Di!

Here is the Maggie Nelson interview: https://www.guernicamag.com/interviews/inflections-forever-new/ 

 
Some of her work: Maggie Nelson selections from Bluets and the Argonauts

Here are the selections from Italo Calvino with commentary:

http://monoskop.org/images/0/0e/Calvino_Italo_Invisible_Cities.pdf

FYI, the book is arranged in 9 cycles with each cycle containing several descriptions of cities--many of the descriptions seem to repeat so starting the book anywhere, or picking passages at random works just fine. Below, I'm just noting key sections, which, taken together, make up a kind of narrative arc. Each cycle is book-ended by a conversation between Kublai Khan and Marco Polo. 

Page 12 - 23: First cycle of the book, which is a good intro to the book's theme/style/content. Introduces Kublai Khan and ends with the first conversation between Marco Polo and Kublai Khan. 

Page 33 - 36: This is the start of the second cycle, which features my (and everybody else's) favorite passage in the whole book. Key quotes on page 36. 

Page 92: The conversation at the start of the sixth cycle is the closest thing the book offers to a crisis or narrative midpoint. Really great passage. 

Page 124: The conversation at the end of the 7th cycle is different from all the other conversations in the book so maybe worth checking out. 

Page 142: Top of ninth cycle features the most Barthesian conversation, e.g. this quote: "It is not the voice that commands the story: it is the ear." 

Page 170: This is the last passage of the book, which is a kind of complement to the top of the ninth cycle, and is just so beautiful.

See you then!
results.name: Maggie Nelson & Italo Calvino

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers 
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships 
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions 
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities 
• Develop new resources and capabilities 
• Become clear about your life’s purpose 
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind 
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us. 
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs. 
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses 
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life. 
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you. 
Discover the passion and power that resides within you 
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind 
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies. 
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

results.description:
Two exciting presentations for our February Meetup! 

You can follow us on twitter: @d3jsNYC

Talk 1:

Pan Wangperawong

Title: D3+React - Build and Manage Large Sophisticated Visual Applications

Description: Come learn how D3 can be used in conjunction with React to build and manage large sophisticated visual applications beyond a single standalone visualization.

Bio: Pan is a Research Software Design Engineer at Microsoft Research. His focus is on building web applications using JavaScript in combination with other open source software to aid research in the area of computational social science. He studied computer science at the University of Southern California and University of Edinburgh. You could learn more about him at panw.weebly.com. He is also helping some companies discover passionate users to give FREE swag (shirts, sweaters, etc). Yes FREE! If you find yourself being enthusiastic about a company and/or product definitely sign up for the private beta at swagggle.weebly.com.


Talk 2:

Nicolas Fernandez

Title: Clustergrammer: A Web-based Visualization Tool for Making and Sharing Interactive Clustered Heatmaps 

Description: Hierarchically clustered heatmaps are a popular visualization method used in biomedical research to display large biological data sets, such as genome-wide expression. Clustergrammer is a web-based matrix visualization tool, built using D3, that enables users to easily generate highly-interactive (zooming, reordering, searching, and filtering) and shareable clustergram-heatmap visualizations. Clustergrammer also provides dynamic visualizations for several other web-apps in the Ma’ayan lab. The presentation will address the motivations behind the project, how D3 was used to build the visualization, and some of my challenges/experiences with D3 along the way. Clustergrammer can be found at http://amp.pharm.mssm.edu/clustergrammer/ and is an open source project available on GitHub. 

Bio: Nicolas Fernandez is a postdoc in Avi Ma’ayan’s lab at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai and is interested in data-science and data-visualization among other things. Nicolas currently works in the field of bioinformatics (e.g. gene expression analysis) and has a background in modeling stochastic biological systems. Nicolas holds a PhD in Biomedical Sciences from Albert Einstein College of Medicine and a BS in Physics from the University of Texas at San Antonio. 

Note: The Ma’ayan lab ( http://icahn.mssm.edu/research/labs/maayan-laboratory) is currently hiring developers. Also, Nicolas will be on the job market this winter.
results.name: February 2016 D3.js Meetup

results.description:
Besides wealth inequality, few issues have had as much attention over the past year than institutional racism. Any other year, the murders of Akai Gurley and Eric Garner might go unnoticed to the general public. It’s also a presidential year and the Democratic Party candidates, among them, a self-proclaimed Democratic Socialist, are being forced to provide solutions to both issues. On Monday, the NYC chapter of DSA is wants to answer the question: Is DSA’s support of Bernie Sanders and his polices going to improve how institutional racism plays out in criminal justice system? What are either candidate proposing and what do their records mean for follow through?

Bob Gangi, who started Police Reform Organizing Project in order to reform the largest police department in the country, the NYPD, has been invited to evaluate Sanders' propositions and discuss the work and upcoming projects of his organization.
Please check out this short video clip ( http://brotherhood-sistersol.org/gallery/one-city-fair-policing ) of Bob as he explains Broken Windows, the other prevailing policing philosophy besides the Drug War, which disproportionately effects people of color.
results.name: Discuss Bernie Sanders' Criminal Justice Platform, with Special Guest Bob Gangi!

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
There are Resources Everywhere--Part B

Sura 16 Ayas 10–13

It is He who sends water from the skies; from it you drink and so do the plants which your cattle eat.

With it He causes crops to grow and olives and dates and grapes and all the fruits. Surely, in this there is a message for people who think.

And He has made the night and the day and the sun and the moon subservient to you; and the stars are subservient by His command. Surely, in this, there are messages for people who use their reason.

And what He created on the earth has many shades of colors. Surely, in this, there is a message for people who reflect.

These ayas point out that nature becomes subservient to those who think, use their reason and reflect. These human traits allow people to discover the resources in nature and improve life. It is inspirations from ayas like these that guided the early Muslims to explore nature and become leaders in science and technology.

But later on  Muslim culture changed. Memorization and recitation without meaning became the methods of learning, not thinking or using reason. This resulted in mistrust of science, social stagnation and poverty.

You are welcome to bring healthy snacks to share after the meeting.


Our discussions are based on the book 'The Quran and The Life of Excellence.'

  Notice: The attendees will be requested to contribute $ 5 each to help with the cost of renting the meeting room.
results.name: Quran Discussion in Manhattan-There are Resources Everywhere-Part B

results.description:
Greetings:

This months tasting looks to be very exciting.

The grapes? The two grapes typically associated with the Rhone Valley. So in addition to Grenache or Syrah, you may bring a Rhone blend of some sort. We ask that you put what you bring as a note in your RSVP. Wines in the Rhone region, but not part of the AOC, are permitted. 

The grapes: Grenache and Syrah. You'll find these grapes all over the world. Grenache is also called Cannonau and Garnacha. Some other regions: Priorat (please, please consider bringing one of these). Even the Barossa Valley in Australia brings some blends as well.

We'd like a breadth of regions for the single varieties, so let us know in the RSVP.

Those who donate will allow me to purchase wines from Cote Rotie and CDP blends, as they are particularly expensive. 


We will divide the wines into Old World and New World; Blends and Varietals.

We will allow some room for those who bring single varietals of Mouvedre / Monastrell, Cinsault, and Viognier.

The rules:

Bring a wine between $15-25 + an appetizer and $5-10 for the sparkler and cleanup. If you find a great wine under $15, no problem. If you cook a whole meal for us, just bring the meal. 


You may join with someone else and bring a $30-40 bottle if you'd like. 

$40 for the evening (that includes sparkler, appetizer and cleanup) and you don't need to bring a thing. Just let me know. Then I get some pizza and you contribute to a more expensive bottle. 

Questions? Text or email me.
results.name: Grenache Vs Garnacha and Shiraz Vs Syrah. And GSM blends.

Join us on February 22 for the first night of neurohacking this year! We'll be working on a new community project, OpenEXP, for running experiments with EEG, discussing potential projects to pursue on an ongoing basis, and getting down and dirty with some hardware, code, and bio-signals. There will be EMG-powered robotic arms and brain waves galore. :D

We have a number of EEG and human-computer interface devices, including a bunch of OpenBCI boards, an Emotiv Insight, a few NeuroSky headsets, and a lots of other biosensors.

If you have your own neurotech devices, please bring them! Otherwise just bring your brain and the desire to create and collaborate!

There is an attendance fee of $10/person for food and drinks!

results.description:
Stressed? Overwhelmed? Always Worrying? Stuck in Negative Thought Patterns?

Come Experience the Benefits of Meditation & Mindfulness with us!

Just like we use exercise to maximize the health and fitness of our bodies, we also need to train our mind and emotions.

Current science supports the benefit of mindfulness for a variety of physical and mental health conditions, and for the general challenges of life in the 21st century. Research shows mindfulness can impact life positively in the following ways:

Reduce stress
Reduce chronic physical pain
Boost the immune system
Reduce emotional reactivity
Increase self-awareness
Improve attention and concentration
Enhance positive emotions
Cultivate well-being and happiness
Positively impact the brain

If you're new to meditation, don't get caught up in the "how". Join us to discuss many different ways to relax your body and mind to create more mindfulness in your everyday life! Meditation & Mindfulness Class
Every Monday at 7pm
$10 donation per class
results.name: Attend: Meditation & Mindfulness Class

Ulrike is the co-author of the International Best-Seller 'Imagine a Healthy You' and an inspirational speaker. results.description:
The Boys in the Boat, by Daniel James Brown, a NYT bestseller.

Out of the depths of the Depression comes an irresistible story about beating the odds and finding hope in the most desperate of times—the improbable, intimate account of how nine working-class boys from the American West showed the world at the 1936 Olympics in Berlin what true grit really meant.



It was an unlikely quest from the start. With a team composed of the sons of loggers, shipyard workers, and farmers, the University of Washington’s eight-oar crew team was never expected to defeat the elite teams of the East Coast and Great Britain, yet they did, going on to shock the world by defeating the German team rowing for Adolf Hitler. The emotional heart of the tale lies with Joe Rantz, a teenager without family or prospects, who rows not only to regain his shattered self-regard but also to find a real place for himself in the world. Drawing on the boys’ own journals and vivid memories of a once-in-a-lifetime shared dream, Brown has created an unforgettable portrait of an era, a celebration of a remarkable achievement, and a chronicle of one extraordinary young man’s personal quest.

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration.

REGISTER: https://circling.eventbrite.com/

For experienced Circlers, the evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm.
On select evenings, Beginners are invited to join us at 6:30 pm.

See the schedule below:

Feb 8 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
Feb 15 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
Feb 22 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
Feb 29 - Community Circling Night 7:30- 10:30 EVERYONE
March 7 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
March 14 - 6:30 beginners, 7:30 everyone
March 21 - 7:30 Experienced Circlers
March 28 - Community Circling Night 7:30-10:30 EVERYONE

Please be punctual and check-in prior to start time in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Circling Lab will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator.

Participation is limited
Registering guarantees your spot

***NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event

Upcoming dates are listed below!

What’s it like to experience Circling?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling?

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas.

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

What is Circling?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night)

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25

Questions about Circling and Authentic Relating NYC?
Contact Amy at [masked]

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living
227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd)
NY, NY 10010

This is a chance to share what you are studying, seeking, yearning after. Members in turn present for 5 minutes on something new one has learned or a piece of art one has created. Each month, one book will be suggested for group discussion, and members may suggest books as well. We are all our own teachers and likewise artists in each our actions. You decide (and have decided) what deserves your attention. You carry curiosity to its ends. Have you wondered how far it can go? Come join us and see.

Tejas Potyński will be your host for the evening. He is a student currently on hiatus from schooling. He attended the University of California, Merced, where he studied English literature and writing. He spent a year studying abroad in Berlin, focusing on the German language and philosophy.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and what we have to offer so you can have the sex life and relationships that you really want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at this event are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

results.description:
What if accessing your desire is the thing that can truly give you fulfillment? What if real health and deep intimate relationships only comes from a life lived in accordance with what your body wants? Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. 

How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created. It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. 

Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses. What comes up might surprise you! At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want. 

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City. 

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!). 

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery! 

Come early, we start on time. COST TO ATTEND IS $10. 

For info contact [masked] Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: Intimacy and Communication Games @TurnON Bushwick

results.description:
HackerNest Tech Socials are informal monthly meetups where the NYC tech community gets together at a local venue to hang out, make new friends, and take a break from coding.

All you have to do is show up, grab a nametag, find a beer/wine/water, and hang out - that's it, there's literally nothing formal planned. Plan on meeting new friends in the tech industry, and getting into heated debates about Emacs & Vim.

Best of all, it's free (as in beer).

Still confused? That's OK, you'll figure it out. For more info: 
HackerNest FAQ | HackerNest Twitter | HackerNest Facebook

Attendees:

That's you! Thanks for coming. Attendance is free, so all you need to do is be friendly and welcoming. We expect everyone to respect the HackerNest "No Douchebag" policy, which includes everything on the JSConf Code of Conduct, but also includes other forms of harassment like soliciting business or aggressively recruiting. Events like ours rely on everyone being great, so if you see someone being less than awesome, let us know, and they can take it elsewhere :)

Sponsors:

Sponsors make this growing movement possible, so we treasure and build deep, long-term relationships with the companies that endorse us. If you are the real deal and want to connect with the NYC tech community, let us know.

Become a HackerNestNYC Sponsor


Venue:

WeWork Charging Bull: A platform for creators

Thanks to WeWork for hosting us in their killer space downtown. They've got a ton of locations all over the city for your co-working needs - check them out!

Wanna show off your office? We're always looking for big open spaces with 200+ (standing room) capacity that are easily accessible. Email us! 

Host a HackerNestNYC Event

Volunteers: 

Every city has a small team of volunteers that makes HackerNest possible. Usually, this just involves moving furniture, putting beer on ice, serving drinks, etc., and we will never let it take over your whole night. So if you can spare some time to pitch in and help out, please do!

Become a HackerNestNYC Volunteer
results.name: HackerNest NYC February Tech Social

Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

results.description:
It is fairly difficult to sit by yourself and meditate. Some people are really good at it, but what about the rest of us? IDK about you, but when I have to meditate I feel like the moment I sit still


 - I  start itching all over

 - I get bored

 -  My mind starts to wander

 Mediation has many benefits 

It  helps steer people's lives in the right direction. Meditating in a group can be powerful and allows manifestation of dreams and aspirations to come about faster. So join me and let's look toward the future.

Address - 176 state street, teaneck,nj
cost - $5 (donation based)
Just be prepared to have fun and have an open mind.

I believe 

-if you keep your faith

-you keep your trust

-you keep the right attitude

-if you're grateful

you'll see God open up new doors.
Joel Osteen

results.description:
This is a meeting for people who have, or who have had at some point in the past, a good grasp of Latin grammar. If you studied Latin for a few years in high school, chances are you'll be able to catch up without too much trouble. If you're just starting out, it might not be your cup of tea. If you're not sure, email the organizer and we can discuss it.

For next week, read lines 1-150 of Capitulum 40 of Lingua Latína II: Roma Æterna, and, if you like, reread Capitulum 2 of Familia Romana. Texts are downloadable at Lingua Latina per se Illustrata or for sale at Focus. Other resources are available at the website with videos and the flashcard website.

Macte virtúte!

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
Join in on NYSR Summer Distance Reiki Shares!

Boost your work week! RSVP to participate in the NYSR Distance Reiki Shares! With “Right Mind and Intention”, Distance Reiki sessions are as effective as sessions conducted in person.


These Summer Reiki Shares are a group effort of Practitioners who collaborate for the benefit of healing, supporting our personal lives, and enhancing the development of Reiki Skills, including sensitivity to giving and receiving Reiki.

AND YOU CAN DO THIS FROM HOME!

Mondays at 10PM for 45 minutes, we practice Distance Reiki among all participants that RSVP. Angela and I prepare “space” 15 minutes prior to start time and your participation will involve the following:

1. Sit or Lay comfortably and quietly.

2. *Set your intent to heal yourself and others participating to receive
whatever is needed for healing to take place.

3. Hold the space for energy to flow, remembering your own
connection to “Oneness” which supports the flow of energy
between the practitioner and recipient.

4. Once your ready and  receptive to receive, set your intent to begin sharing Reiki.

*Participant names will be forwarded via email or text if you prefer. Please use firstname and lastname initial (i.e.Michelle D.) or your Meetup ID Name.when you RSVP. Guest welcome and must RSVP individually; also required to submit (min) $10 donation via PayPal.

There is no “cancellation of energy”. Each individual receives as much Reiki needed at the present time to assist with the unique situations of his/her own life.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE

 


 A steady pace all the way so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker .


4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 6:00AM.  Don't be late.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. results.description:
{podcast} Meditation for Highly Sensitive People This month's virtual event will be all about the value of being a LIVING Meditator. 

What does that mean? To me this means bringing presence, mindfulness, awareness, and connection with yourself and others into everything you do. I’ve been cultivating this practice over the last 8 years and I must say, it is much easier to hold a safe space with compassion and acceptance for myself and others, no matter where I am since bringing these practices into my life as a Highly Sensitive Person. {Side Note: I used to loathe going to parties or social events where I didn’t know anyone b/c I always felt a disconnect with who might be there. I had a pervasive worry of being misunderstood and feeling overwhelmed as I crept into the people pleasing shadow and didn’t know how to break free from it. Since committing to a meditation practice, being mindful, and aware of how I am feeling at all times, I am able to step away when I need to, ask for what I need, and be vulnerable in a safe way that doesn't make the other person fell uncomfortable. Over time, this has gotten much better, and my ability to create boundaries with others has gotten stronger and more effective…allowing for connection rather than judgment and isolation.} So there’s my little spiel to give you a taste of what this month’s podcast will be about.

If it resonates with you, I recommend registering to receive the podcast here, which will be released Tuesday February 23rd at 6am EST: http://forms.aweber.com/form/28/1391980528.htm

--- --- ---

And now a few words to get the ball rolling...! 

Why is meditation important if you are a HSP? Here are just 3 reasons... 

1. We are easily Over-Stimulated. Mindfulness Meditation and other Energy Management practices can train your subconscious mind to filter through the stimuli you receive from your environment much more efficiently so that overstimulation happens less and you feel less overwhelmed and reactive to your environment. In turn, you will start to feel more present, consciously responsive, clear, and grounded in your interactions; enjoyable or challenging. 

2. We Feel Deeply. This is indeed one of our gifts! But this strength turns into a shortcoming when it is not properly utilized and managed. I'm certain at some point on your journey you've been emotionally overwhelmed and didn't know how to balance the emotional roller coaster, yes? I know I've struggled with this. CONSISTENTLY practicing mindfuless practices helps you become more aware of what you are feeling SOONER so that your emotions don't take you over, but rather, allow you to shift earlier than later when your emotions feel daunting, heavy, and out of control. Let's rein those emotions in early, shall we? Meditation = Our Friend. 

3. We Think Deeply. Another gift of ours that allow us to think outside of the box and utilize our inner world (our imagination) that is expansive and creative. Our depth in thinking and processing allows us to be open to possibilities, be insightful, and create meaning out of this (so it seems) flat life that we are living. But again, this strength turns into a shortcoming when you go too far down the rabbit hole of judgment and constrictive thought processes. Instead, why consciously choose what you allow yourself to think and imagine? I can't tell you how many times I used my deep thinking skills, my imagination, to WORRY about potential false outcomes. I did this to try and prevent myself from being hurt. However, worry does not prevent you from failing or getting hurt, it only puts you in a space of fear, activating your stress response, and actually prevents your brain from problem solving quickly and efficiently in a time of need. Will you choose panic? Or presence and assertiveness? Meditation – 3 Worry – 0 Meditation helps with ALL of these (and more!). Come and meditate with me. Beginners are welcome, and of course, for those of you have been doing this for awhile, it’s always a good idea to revisit what you've already heard b/c one of the things many HSPs struggle with is CONSISTENCY. "We can do together what we can never do alone." Register for the Meditation for HSPs podcast here:


http://forms.aweber.com/form/28/1391980528.htm

Once you register, you will be added to my virtual community where you will receive my videos, podcasts, and email updates. You can opt out at any time. The podcast will be released Tuesday February 23rd @ 6am EST. Register at the link above anytime before then to receive the link for the recording. Email me if you have any questions: [masked] Talk soon! With love, Karina

P.S. Once you register, be sure to CONFIRM YOUR SUBSCRIPTION by going to your email and following the link provided! This is a very important step to receive the podcast recording.
results.name: Free Podcast - Meditation for Highly Sensitive People

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Sinigual Restaurant
41st and 3rd Ave
(640 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)
