results.description:
Back to Spain, to explore a region that is less well known than the subregions within it—Castilla y León. 

Castilla y León is the largest of Spain’s 17 administrative regions and covers the northern half of the central Iberian plateau.  The region’s agriculture is largely focused on grains, but viticulture has taken place here for a couple of millennia.  The climate is very much continental—hot summers, cold winters, sharp daily temperature shifts during the growing season.  A coastal mountain range, the Cordillera Cantábrica, prevents any maritime influence.  Rainfall is low, soils are mostly thin and poor, with more clay and mineral around the rivers that flow through the area.  And the region’s most prestigious winegrowing districts are in the Duero Valley, near the river that becomes the Douro on the other side of the Portuguese border.  This is Tempranillo country, although the grape is known locally as Tinto Fino, Tinto del Pais, or Tinto de Toro.

We’ll be trying wines from six appellations.

Rueda:  This is one of the few Spanish wine regions that are best known for superior white wines.  Sherry-like fortified wines once dominated here, based on the Palomino grape, but in the 1970s, Rioja’s Bodegas Marques de Riscal saw the potential for dry unfortified white wines using the aromatic, fruity varietal Verdejo, which now accounts for 90 percent of production.  Cool nights help preserve the wine’s fresh acidity in this otherwise hot region.  Much of the Verdejo is unoaked, preserving the wine’s fruit-forward qualities, but some producers are now employing barrel fermentation.  We’ll be trying two Rueda Verdejos, one unoaked and made from an almost-extinct Verdejo clone, and a notably oaky barrel-fermented example.  It will be interesting to see which production method better complements the grape’s qualities. 

Toro:  Just west of Rueda and 40 miles east of the Portuguese border lies Toro, named after a town of the same name.  It seems appropriate that the local wines, powerful reds based on the local Tempranillo strain, Tinta de Toro, call to mind the image of a bull.  The hot continental climate means that these grapes achieve high potential alcohol, so local authorities put a 15 percent cap on alcohol content for Toro wines.  The prestige of the region has been enhanced by investment by well-known winemakers from outside the area, such as Ribera del Duero’s Vega Sicilia.  We’ll be trying a Toro made by a former Vega Sicilia winemaker from old-vines ungrafted Tinta de Toro.  Judicious use of French oak preserves the wine’s elegance and character. 

Tierra del Vino de Zamora:  West of Toro lies Tierra del Vino de Zamora, a new appellation that acquired DO status in 2008.  It shares the climatic characteristics of Toro, but grows a greater variety of grapes—Malvasia, Godello, Verdejo, Tempranillo, Garnacha, and Cabernet Sauvignon, among others.  Nevertheless, Tempranillo still dominates.  The most prestigious maker in the region is Bodega Viñas del Cenit, and we will be trying their 2009 Via Cenit, made organically with old-vines Tempranillo (some over 100 years old), and matured in French oak.

Cigales: East of Toro lies Cigales, another relatively new appellation that lies at a higher altitude than its western neighbor.  This is a relatively undeveloped region, which has the advantage of preserving traditional viticultural methods and old vines.  Tempranillo (aka Tinta del Pais) dominates.  We’ll be trying a wine made by Rioja’s Baron de Ley at their Cigales winery, Finca Museum, where their goal is to make high-quality, value-priced wines from old-vines Tempranillo.

Ribera del Duero:  This is the most important and prestigious region within Castilla y León.  A relatively young DO (established in 1982), it now rivals Rioja as the most prestigious producer of Spanish red wines.  As the name suggests, the region straddles the Duero River, which provides a much-needed water supply and a limestone, chalk, and clay topsoil that adds complexity to the wines.  The star producer of the region is Vega Sicilia, whose flagship Unico wine is like the Spanish equivalent of a Bordeaux first growth.  Tempranillo must make up at least 75 percent of Ribera del Duero wine, with Bordeaux varietals usually used for blending.  Our Ribera del Duero comes from Hacienda Monasterio, where the resident winemaker is Danish enologist Peter Sisseck, who founded Pingus, another benchmark wine for the region.  Hacienda Monasterio represents unusual value for top-quality Ribera del Duero.

Sardon del Duero:  This is a contiguous region to the west of Ribera del Duero that shares the same geographic and climatic conditions.  The biggest name in the region is Abadia Retuerta, an ultramodern winery that maintains high quality standards for its Tempranillo wines despite large-volume production.  We’ll be trying their 2010 Selección Especial. 

We’ll be dining on the Upper West Side for the first time, at The Milling Room on Columbus.  Note earlier starting time—6:30.


http://www.themillingroom.com/

2014 Javier Sanz V Malcorta (Rueda)  $23

Wine Advocate 90 – Produced with an old Verdejo clone called “malcorta,” the 2014 V Malcorta has some tropical aromas of pineapple intermixed with more serious aromas of hay and straw, over a core of white fruit. The palate is intense with a combination of pineapple and leesy flavors, as it was matured in contact with the lees with bâttonage for some four months before bottling.

2011 Naia Naiades (Rueda)  $26

Jancis Robinson 16/20 – Creamy, rich, super-smooth. Good persistence and fruit purity, though quite reliant on caramel oak for complexity.

2011 Bodegas y Viñedos Maurodos San Roman (Toro)  $30

Wine Advocate 92 – The 2011 San Roman, is year in, year out, one of the most reliable wines of the appellation, pure Tempranillo (locally known as Tinta de Toro), the fruit from over 35-year-old, ungrafted and head-pruned vineyards planted on sandy, stony soils rich in clay in different villages across the Toro appellation. The wine aged for two years in French and American oak barrels, 80% of which were new. It’s an earthy wine with plenty of dark aromas of peat, fountain pen ink, graphite, and tar, with very ripe fruit, black and blue berries. The palate is quite full-bodied, with abundant but fine tannins and enough acidity and persistence. A Toro with character.

Wine Spectator 93 – Black plum, coffee, and mineral notes show depth and richness in this plush, firm red, with plenty of structure. Balanced and harmonious, ending with an alluring floral finish.

2009 Viñas del Cenit Via Cenit (Tierra del Vino de Zamora)  $30

Wine Advocate 91 – 100% Tempranillo.  The 2009 Via Cenit spent 12 months in French oak. It is purple/black in color with an impressive aromatic display of pain grillé, pencil lead, violets, incense, and blackberry. Full-bodied, structured, dense, and mouth-filling, it has the stuffing to evolve for 3-4 years and will provide pleasure through 2024 if not longer. Savory, ripe, and lengthy, it admirably reflects the superb conditions presented by the 2009 vintage.

2010 Bodegas Museum Vinea Tempranillo Crianza (Cigales)  $16

Wine Advocate 88 – The 2010 Vinea Tempranillo Crianza sees 15 months in oak barrel (60% American and 40% French) and is bottled unfiltered. It offers a generous, clean, sumptuous bouquet of dark plum, blueberry, mulberry, and mocha that displays good intensity. The palate is medium bodied with a soft, rounded entry. There is decent weight here for a Crianza, but it never tries to be overly ambitious. Rather, it aims for the “drinkability jugular” with its soft, caressing tannins and rich dark plum and mocha-tinged finish. This is well-crafted and epitomizes the kind of Spanish wine that gets finished to the bottom of the bottle.

2010 Abadia Retuerta Selección Especial (Sardón del Duero)  $28

Wine Spectator 92 – This red shows a smooth texture that masks the firm structure, with well-integrated tannins and bright acidity supporting focused flavors of cherry, berry, mineral, and loam. Balanced, graceful, and deep. Tempranillo, Syrah, and Cabernet Sauvignon.

Jancis Robinson 17.5/20 – 75% Tempranillo, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Syrah. 16 months in French and American oak. Excellent winemaking. Intense ripe black fruits, mint notes and nutmeg touch. High-tech palate, providing creamy texture with sweet and caramelized tannins. Confected but seductive mid body with great balance. Super consistent and reliable for a production of 550,000 bottles. 

2010 Hacienda Monasterio Reserva (Ribera del Duero)  $64

Wine Advocate 95 – The 2010 Reserva contains 20% Cabernet Sauvignon from selected plots from their slope vineyards planted 25 years ago on chalk-rich soils that fermented with indigenous yeasts. 2010 was a near-perfect growing season, producing wines that are both powerful and fresh and that should have a long life in bottle. The nose is fragrant and elegant, mixing notes of red and black fruit with a sense of extreme harmony. Very showy. As much as it’s elegant it also feels powerful and serious, quite Ribera, with good typicity. The palate is medium to full-bodied, with polished tannins, and is supple and tasty and with great acidity and length. A balanced, elegant vintage, not showy or voluptuous, but more serious and developing complexity. A fine and elegant Ribera. Bravo! At this quality level this represents very good value.

Wine Spectator 94 – This big red offers both polish and density, with muscular, well-integrated tannins supporting the rich texture. The flavors are more harmonious than expressive, with plum, licorice, tar, mineral and coffee notes. Impressive structure.

results.description:
Book Description:
This stunning, exquisitely written collection introduces a cast of remarkable characters whose lives intersect in ways both life-affirming and heartbreaking. A 1930s Soviet censor painstakingly corrects offending photographs, deep underneath Leningrad, bewitched by the image of a disgraced prima ballerina. A chorus of women recount their stories and those of their grandmothers, former gulag prisoners who settled their Siberian mining town. Two pairs of brothers share a fierce, protective love. Young men across the former USSR face violence at home and in the military. And great sacrifices are made in the name of an oil landscape unremarkable except for the almost incomprehensibly peaceful past it depicts. In stunning prose, with rich character portraits and a sense of history reverberating into the present, The Tsar of Love and Techno is a captivating work from one of our greatest new talents
results.name: The Tsar of Love and Techno by Anthony Marra

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your NEW YEAR with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
Spiro Condos will lead a discussion on the many questions currently roiling the Skeptic community and the many arguments to be made pro and con about the recent NECSS decision to disinvite Richard Dawkins from this year's conference; we will discuss them without any one “answer” being given, hopefully without fistfights!

Has Dawkins crossed a line that properly disqualified him from speaking to the NECSS community? Does any speech have a protected place in the skeptic community? Did the Board act improperly when they didn’t contact Dawkins before rescinding their invitation?  Did it matter? Was the disinvitation about feminism or about the courtesy and respect due anyone with whom you disagree? Is this a “freedom of speech” issue? Are we worrying too much about internecine squabbles and losing sight of the big picture?

Although Spiro Condos was on the NECSS board until recently, he was not involved with the decision to disinvite Dawkins. He is still an active member of the NYC Skeptics board.  He will be appearing purely on his own behalf, and his opinions do not necessarily represent the opinions of either board.


NOTE: We ask that, as a courtesy, members who RSVP and decide later not to attend please change their RSVPs to no at least 48 hours before the event.

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
Celebrated French author Maylis de Kerangal and American writer and literary critic John Freeman will discuss their latest work, A ce stade de la nuit and Tales of two Cities, and the new face of poverty and exclusion both in Europe and in the USA. The conversation will be moderated by Arian Murati.

A ce stade de la nuit is a nocturnal meditation inspired by the island Lampedusa. The name of this little piece of land off the Italian shore brings to mind the author of the novel The Leopard, immortalized on the screen by Visconti. Both a literary and cinematic symbol, Lampedusa has become not only the center of a modern human tragedy where the makeshift boats of African migrants end their desperate course, but also the new face of an inhospitable Europe.
The stories in Tales of Two Cities mix fiction and reportage to convey the indignities and heartbreak, the callousness and solidarity, of living side-by-side with people who have a stupefyingly different income. Eschewing more direct sociological or economic analysis, the pieces here focus on the human dimension of penury and profligacy coexisting in the tightest of quarters. With writing that will move the reader, not just emotionally but perhaps, too, to action, this anthology gives life to the meaning of those words[it’s not clear which words] in the streets and buildings of the metropolis.

In English. Free and open to the public.
No RSVP necessary.
972 Fifth Avenue (at 79th Street)
New York, NY 10075
Subway: 4/5/6 at 86th St & 6 at 77th St
Bus: M79/M1/M2/M3/M4
results.name: A Conversation with Maylis de Kerangal and John Freeman - Host: Mila

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

The Dinner by Herman Koch

"Polite conversation in polite company in a polite restaurant is truly secret savagery. It is a savagery that lurks beneath even the most mundane of events where that very common surface doesn't smooth the unsavory over but simply masks and amplifies it. From the picking of a special vintage to the agony of what appetizer to choose, something dark hides behind the sudden knowing glances exchanged and the abrupt trips to the bathroom that dot this novel like blood trailed home from a crime scene."

results.description:
The African Poetry Theater is looking for 15 students to start a free film class, which is open to first generation and immigrant filmmakers in Queens, NY. Please contact the theater for more details about applying to the great opportunity.


"Our Stories" is a cultural exchange and multi-cultural educational program that is centered around the art of film-making. This Program is a three (3) month crash course that consists of a total of 72 program hours; three (3) hours per class session, twice a week, ending with a culminating event.

Month One: The Fundamentals of Film-making. Students will learn about film genres, production, directing, character development, etc.

Month Two: Forming a Film Crew. Students will learn about field production. We suggest dividing the students (we expect there will 15 students in total) into 3 groups of 5. Each group will pick a fictitious name for their film crew/production company and then vote on assignment of crew responsibilities (director, producer/writer, writer, camera, sound & editor). Each film crew will pick a film genre (comedy, drama, documentary, etc.) and then create a 30 minute short film that relates to IMMIGRATION and/or the social impact of it, or a story about their personal/family experiences as immigrants.

Month Three: Making the film. Students will shoot and edit their short films. After completion, the 3 films will be shared with the entire class and a respected film critic to be viewed, discussed/critiqued, and judged. The course will culminate in an event that will double as a mini-Film Festival on immigration. Family, friends, other filmmakers, and the public will be invited to this screening, where all three films will be shown, followed by a Q & A to be conducted by the students.
results.name: Free Film Class Opportunity

Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

results.description:
Middle-aged family man Frank (Jim Karen) trains teenaged Freddy (Thom Matthews) for his new job at a medical supply warehouse. In an effort to impress and frighten his young charge, practical joker Frank reveals that the warehouse basement contains a cannister full of a mysterious chemical capable of bringing the dead back to life. It seems that the cannister fell off the back of an army truck during an accidental outbreak of zombiedom. Frank and Freddy unwittingly inhale the chemical and release it into the warehouse. Turning to the operator of a nearby crematorium for help in destroying the suddenly undead specimens that surround them, they unwittingly awaken the residents of a nearby cemetary just as Freddy's pals arrive to party amidst the headstones and wait for their friend's shift to end. Meanwhile, Col. Glover (Jonathan Terry) waits for the call that his missing chemical weapon has been unleashed.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GkhCAV3wmIU

This will sell out, get your tickets here: http://www.nitehawkcinema.com/movie/return-of-the-living-dead/

In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the richness of whats happening in relationship with others, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness. You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, " in the moment" conversations Ive seen become possible for them.

Likewise, the more Ive seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, grow in a sense of presence and natural interest in others, and generally embody a deep capacity for presence and authenticity.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! The cost is $20

Video storytellers, creative directors, journalists, filmmakers, commissioning editors and publishers: Join us on Tuesday, Feb 23rd for #ScreenUpNYC at the Made in NY Media Center by IFP in Dumbo, Brooklyn. 

Seats are limited, RSVP here.

Hosted by Storyhunter, the network of over 10,000 media professionals in 170+ countries, ScreenUps are a time to get together for happy hour once a month with like-minded creatives to watch some of the latest and greatest in short-form video, and chat with the filmmaker who made them.  

This month we'll be showcasing several videos from Great Big Story, CNN's new digital venture. We'll be honored to be joined by Matt Drake, Director of Content Development at GBS, and also chat with the filmmakers they've worked with around the world (via video chat). 

The other filmmakers TBA

Have you you want to suggest an amazing video or initiative that should screen, suggest it here! 

PROGRAM:

6:30pm-7:30pm - reception/drinks at Media Center's Cuper Cafe  

7:30pm-9pm - screening of several videos with Q&A with filmmakers 

9pm-10pm - hanging out, music and networking

WHERE:  Made in NY Media Center by IFP 
                30 John St. Dumbo, Brooklyn (map)
results.name: ScreenUpNYC: Great Big Story, and more

results.description:
Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: iHeartRadio

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!
results.name: Tuesday Office Hours

Did you know that beer was invented before wine? Did you know that in places where grapes cannot be grown, people drank beer instead? Did you know that beer can be aged just like wine and can cost upwards of $110 for a six pack? Did you know that a beer can complement your meal as well as wine can?

Our beer appreciation class re-introduces you to the world of beer. We veer far from the traditional American commercial beers, focusing on craft breweries from around the world. Just like it is impossible to hate bread, it's impossible to hate beer!

results.description:
About Enviromental Green Drinks Gatherings

Environmental Green Drinks is an informal monthly get-together for people interested in green living, sustainable business and building communities that are safe for living, biking, walking and growing food. We meet at places where the food is excellent and the prices are good.

Green Drinks are open, admission is free and new faces are always welcome, so come and join us some evening!

Acerca de las Reuniones Green Drinks

Green Drinks es un informal evento social para gente interesada en la sostenibilidad y el medio ambiente. Las reuniones facilitan el intercambio informal de ideas y estrategias "verdes" y colaboraciones comunitarias e individuales. Conversamos sobre alternativos fuentes de energía limpia, producción agrícola urbana, la comida natural y orgánica, comprar local, los empleos verdes. . . y la justicia ambiental. Nuestros encuentros están abiertos a la comunidad y todos encontrarán una calurosa bienvenida.

Os Eventos Green Drinks

Green Drinks é um evento social informal para dialogar sobre o estabelecimento duma sociedade sustentável, justa e no qual os comerciantes e indivíduos respeitam os recursos da terra e seus habitantes. A comunidade está muito bem vinda!

Food | Comida

Pay only for food and drinks you order..
Sólo se pagan la comida y bebidas que usted pide. 
Paga só à comida e bebidas que você solicite.

Admission & Parking | Entrada Estacionamento Parqueo

Admission free. Free on-site parking in restaurant lot at end of side street.
Entrada grátis. Grátis estacionamiento en el parqueadero del local.
Entrada gratuita. Estacionamento gratuito no local.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Want to meet new people to discuss your political beliefs with?  

Hoping to make new business and life connections?  


If so we welcome you to attend the next Greenspeakers meeting.  Greenspeakers is a Toastmasters club that was founded by Green Party members many years ago to provide a forum for engaged and intelligent citizens to improve their public speaking skills.  The club isn't as focused on politics as it once was but many members do love to debate.  

Every person who attends Greenspeakers will have a chance to speak and all will learn helpful tricks to become a more confident public speaker and communicator.  

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
On Tuesday, February 23rd, the Bergen County branch of the NAACP will host a town hall style forum to discuss transparency within government and law enforcement agencies and the intent of the Open Public Records Act. 

The event was prompted by a bill introduced by State Senator Paul Sarlo (District 36 - Bergen and Passaic) that would shield police videos and recordings of 911 calls from public view. 

The bill (S788) would create an exemption to the State’s open public records law for law enforcement camera recordings and 9-1-1 audio recordings or transcripts. 

The forum will be held at 7:00 pm in the Teaneck High School Media Center located at 100 Elizabeth Avenue in Teaneck and State Senator Paul Sarlo has agreed to attend and take questions.

<a>More Details...</a>
results.name: Forum on  Law Enforcement Transparency

results.description:
This is a free event.  First come first serve. (Likely a popular event so show as early as your schedule permit.)  Doors open at 7:30 pm. Please bring ID: 21+. No cover. Just bring your smart self! 


Biological Anthropologist & Love-ologist Helen Fisher on the "Anatomy of Love" @ the Bell House, FREE! 

Love...  it's the inspiration for googly-eyed hand-holding, drunk texting, drive-thru wedding chapels, and nights of endless brooding. Love is uncontrollable, elusive, essential, joyful and heart-wrenching. So what does science say about love? At the next Secret Science Club, we’re about to find out…


</a> <a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-nx_csM_cRFY/VrkbiVfhpaI/AAAAAAAAB00/dD4W69v8e-E/s1600/HelenFisher.jpg">

</a>

<a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-nx_csM_cRFY/VrkbiVfhpaI/AAAAAAAAB00/dD4W69v8e-E/s1600/HelenFisher.jpg">

</a>

<a href="https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-nx_csM_cRFY/VrkbiVfhpaI/AAAAAAAAB00/dD4W69v8e-E/s1600/HelenFisher.jpg">

Biological anthropologist 

Helen Fisher

 has written (and re-written) the book on love. She asks: 

Does romantic love have evolutionary roots? Why do we split up and stray? Can love be detected in a brain scan? How often do hookups turn into relationships? What are the signs of love addiction? Is Tinder a source of love at first sight—or cognitive overload?


Helen Fisher

 is a senior research fellow at the Kinsey Institute and a member of the Center for Human Evolutionary Studies in the Department of Anthropology at Rutgers University. She studies the

evolution, brain systems, and cross-cultural patterns of romantic love

, mate choice, marriage, “cheating,” and divorce. She is the author of five books: 

Why Him? Why Her?, Why We Love, The First Sex, The Sex Contract

, and 

Anatomy of Love

, and has been a featured scientist on the 

TED Radio Hour  

http://www.npr.org/2014/04/25/301824760/what-happens-to-our-brain-when-we-re-in-love

, NPR’s 

On Being

, the

Colbert Report,  http://www.cc.com/video-clips/om9959/the-colbert-report-helen-fisher

and 

Anderson Cooper 360

. Dr. Fisher is the chief scientific advisor to Match.com, supervising the design and interpretation of the annual Singles in America national survey.


</a> <a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QcrxgVSn_jQ/VrkamXgADYI/AAAAAAAAB0k/YHjx_dpXfQ8/s1600/AnatomyOfLoveCover.jpg">

</a>

<a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QcrxgVSn_jQ/VrkamXgADYI/AAAAAAAAB0k/YHjx_dpXfQ8/s1600/AnatomyOfLoveCover.jpg">

</a>

<a href="https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QcrxgVSn_jQ/VrkamXgADYI/AAAAAAAAB0k/YHjx_dpXfQ8/s1600/AnatomyOfLoveCover.jpg">

Before & After

--Snag a 

signed copy

 of Helen Fisher’s all-new updated classic, 

Anatomy of Love

--Sway to 

sappy seductive grooves

--Try our 

captivating

cocktail 

of the night, the

Mia Amore

--Stick around for the passion-filled 

Q&A


This love-soaked edition of the 

Secret Science Club

 meets Tuesday, February 23, 2016, 8 pm @ the 

Bell House

, 149 7th St. (between 2nd and 3rd avenues) in Gowanus, Brooklyn. Subway: F or G to 4th Ave; R to 9th St. 


Doors open at 7:30 pm. Please bring ID: 21+. No cover. Just bring your smart self!

results.description:
Do you live in Port Washington, Manhasset, New Hyde Park, Carle Place, Westbury or any other town in the Town of North Hempstead?  Would you like to walk your dogs in town parks instead of along busy streets and sidewalks? Then, join LI-DOG and come to the public hearing on Tues., Feb. 23d at 7:30 p.m. at Town Hall. Let the town know how much you want dog-friendly parks!

In June 2015, North Hempstead Supervisor Judi Bosworth, the Hempstead Town Board, and Parks Commissioner Jill Weber took the historic step of opening three local parks to on-leash dogs as part of a pilot program. The pilot program has reached the six- month point and now a public hearing has been scheduled for Tues., Feb. 23rd to consider letting people walk their dogs in these parks permanently! Read about the pilot program and the parks involved in North Hempstead Public Hearing on our website.


There are always a few people who object, so dog owners need to step up and be heard at the Town Board meeting. Elected officials need to know there are many residents who support park access for dog owners and their dogs!


Don’t let the naysayers outnumber the majority of people who support walking dogs in local parks. Join LI-DOG and bring your friends and family to the Town Board Meeting, too! Let us know if you can come!

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave.

The group meets at The LOFT, the LGBTQ safe space in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month.

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.

results.description:
I am giving plenty of notice on this one, given that the novel is a whopping 944 pages long. I also think that although some people read more during the holiday season, others are so busy that they read less. I didn't want December to get in the way of people who wanted to read.

(Check out the January meeting for Anthony Marra's book if you can't wait so long to discuss something. I'd love to have you there!)


For those of you who follow book news, you'll already know that this debut novel was anticipated for over two years before publication, ever since the news broke that Hallberg received a 2 MILLION DOLLAR advance. (In publishing today that is a huge advance, unless your name is, say, Dan Brown.)

For people who follow such things, an advance of that size immediately raised questions, like "Could it possibly be that good?" It's a question that I had, but I hope to put it aside to try and think about the book in isolation of the buzz it has created.

I started it over a month ago and got sidetracked with other things.  Still, I am looking forward to returning to it. I think there is plenty to talk about. I hope to see you!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This event meets on the fourth Tuesday of each month to discuss a specific topic in Science Fiction, Fantasy, and related genres. This month we are discussing what you would do at the end of the world. For info or directions visit www.waynepubliclibrary.org

This month we take a look at romance in genre...or more specifically, when romance ruins the story, plot, movie.  Things were going along nicely until romance entered the picture.  Many TV met their demise because of an ill-advised romantic entanglement:  Cheers, Moonlight and more.

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday at 8:30pm as La Luz hosts an ALL LEVELS, OPEN,  DROP-IN Improv Comedy Class!!!

We begin the class with a focus on group activities and fun games as we  move towards some individual character building, short and long form scenes, listening, supporting our partner(s), and performing in front an audience.

Each week is a bit different with various teachers from Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, the PIT and places all over the world! Every instructor is a new experience and want our students to have a dynamic well rounded learning experience.

Classes are donation based so please come anyway. We ask $10-13.

Now get on over to La Luz and Let’s Play!!!!

results.description:
Hey Everyone!

The group is once again invited to a great night of comedy on Tues Feb 23rd at 9:30pm at Gotham Comedy Club!

EVERYONE IN THE GROUP CAN GET FREE TICKETS!!!
Bring anyone you'd like, the more the merrier! This is one of the BEST comedy clubs & voted one of the BEST comedy shows in NYC!!

Tickets are normally priced at $15 each! If anyone wants to go, just make sure to RSVP through the online link below to get your tickets.

FREE TICKET LINK: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/free-admission-gotham-comedy-club-tuesday-feb-23rd-930pm-tickets-21460351489

The show is called "Comedy Juice" and features all professional comedians (no amateurs), who you've seen on: Comedy Central, Saturday Night Live, Chelsea Lately, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Conan, etc), HBO, Showtime, & More! This show definitely features some of the BEST comedians in comedy!

In the past few months, this show has had HUGE special guests including: Kevin Hart, Louis CK, Jerry Seinfeld, Dave Attell, Jim Gaffigan, Colin Jost, & Judah Friedlander!!

The show starts at 9:30pm but they request you all arrive inside the club by 9:15pm. There's a great bar next door called Jake's Saloon that everyone can meet up at before the show, this is the easiest way to find & meet the group! Meet at Jake's Saloon by 9pm and go into the comedy club all together!!

The show is 18+ & Gotham Comedy Club has a 2 drink minimum per person (drinks don't have to be alcohol)

Hope to see you all at the show

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Are you having the life, business, or lifestyle you want with your current beliefs? Maybe, you are finally ready to have more of everything you really desire. REAL BELIEFS are more impactful than you may believe and REAL BELIEFS are TRIGGERS to all you want to Attract. The BELIEFS STUDIO is a very different story from the believe stronger answer. That's the old story from the last century that many are still talking about because they don't know any other. Time to learn the real secrets of beliefs. You live inside your head with your beliefs. Wondering how to fix your business strategy, get your business started, find the relationship you desire, feel good about life again? There is a method that you can learn during BELIEFS STUDIO sessions that will transform one major building block of your life.
Start your first STUDIO SESSION with the MOBILE COURSE you can attend right from your smart phone.

RSVP using the link and you will receive the call-in pin and number for this MOBILE COURSE.

WHAT ARE BELIEFS?
Many people feel beliefs are just areas of life they feel strongly about. This is only a small part of a much bigger story? Beliefs are fundamentally PATHWAYS IN BRAIN-mind that our focus and habits travel down as we live. Beliefs control how we experience the world and our every action. Beliefs even keep us in place and frozen from taking action. Each moment of our lives we travel towards our limits or our POSSIBILITIES down the pathways of our beliefs.

THE COGNITIVE TECHNOLOGY OF BELIEF
You don't need another philosophy. What you keep searching for is a way to chart your specific beliefs and a way to ecologically change all the beliefs that are holding you back from success and achievement. Learn this state-of-the-Art of the art technology and method for putting you in charge of your belief systems.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND And BENEFIT?
Entrepreneurs, Running a Start up, Artists, Writers,Self-employed, educators, managers & executives, or Salespersons. Anyone and everyone with beliefs and those who communicate with others that have beliefs. Someone that wants more FREEDOM, CREATIVITY AND ACHIEVEMENT in their lives.

CURATOR

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

results.description:
Are you having the life, business, or lifestyle you want with your current beliefs? Maybe, you are finally ready to have more of everything you really desire. REAL BELIEFS are more impactful than you may believe and REAL BELIEFS are TRIGGERS to all you want to Attract. The BELIEFS STUDIO is a very different story from the believe stronger answer. That's the old story from the last century that many are still talking about because they don't know any other. Time to learn the real secrets of beliefs. You live inside your head with your beliefs. Wondering how to fix your business strategy, get your business started, find the relationship you desire, feel good about life again? There is a method that you can learn during BELIEFS STUDIO sessions that will transform one major building block of your life.
Start your first STUDIO SESSION with the MOBILE COURSE you can attend right from your smart phone.

RSVP using the link and you will receive the call-in pin and number for this MOBILE COURSE.

WHAT ARE BELIEFS?
Many people feel beliefs are just areas of life they feel strongly about. This is only a small part of a much bigger story? Beliefs are fundamentally PATHWAYS IN BRAIN-mind that our focus and habits travel down as we live. Beliefs control how we experience the world and our every action. Beliefs even keep us in place and frozen from taking action. Each moment of our lives we travel towards our limits or our POSSIBILITIES down the pathways of our beliefs.

THE COGNITIVE TECHNOLOGY OF BELIEF
You don't need another philosophy. What you keep searching for is a way to chart your specific beliefs and a way to ecologically change all the beliefs that are holding you back from success and achievement. Learn this state-of-the-Art of the art technology and method for putting you in charge of your belief systems.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND And BENEFIT?
Entrepreneurs, Running a Start up, Artists, Writers,Self-employed, educators, managers & executives, or Salespersons. Anyone and everyone with beliefs and those who communicate with others that have beliefs. Someone that wants more FREEDOM, CREATIVITY AND ACHIEVEMENT in their lives.

CURATOR

The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes; timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
From the magic land of Transylvania (Romania), I bring forth the powerful ancient love ritual of Dragobete. Much older than Valentine’s day, Dragobete is a celebration of love and fertility. The energy associated with it, is the kind necessary to bring love in one’s life and in that sense, Dragobete is a god of love. Even to this day the belief in the Dragobete as a godly spirit still rest within the folklore of the region,most likely passed down from Dacian believes, even if time mixed the ancient tradition and rituals with the more recent Christian religious believes associated with the Finding the head of St. John the Baptist holiday. The most important thing is that the tradition and it’s energy survived to this day with little change from the old times.
Dragobete is celebrated on February 24, a day when nature itself shows it’s signs of love. It is the day when birds start mating and snowdrops, the first flowers of spring, delight us with their presence.

The origin of the word Dragobete is controversial. One hypothesis that matches the believes of people inhabiting the lands more than 2000 years ago states that the word Dragobete derives from the Dacian words Trago – “buck” or “billy goat” and bete – feet ( pedes in Latin ) . Having lost if the Dacian language , Trago became Drago and Pede – bete( as they call the narrow woven strips for lady’s girdle ) . The goat symbolizes the power of procreation , life force , fecundity.

Drag, the root of the word Dragobete exists in other Indo-European languages ​​, for example, the Latvian ,, dargts ” in the old Prussian dear ,, ” ,, Dargel ” in Irish ,, dir “in English ,, dear ” etc. Many researchers believe that these words come from a Proto-Indo -European root : dhegu ,, heat .

Because of her bloodline and initiations, Rox can tap into the energy of Dragobete and bring it to places far from Romania. This year, for the first time, because of the numerous request for help with love matters received she decided to perform the powerful ritual at her place in the USA. The energy will be brought forth and then distributed to all those requesting it. If you want to be the beneficiary of such life transforming energy, please let us know. Your presence to the ritual is not required, but tips of what to do to receive the full strength of this energy in your own place will be provided.

The price for this event is $15, payable by clicking the “Donate” button on the pathtolight.net website. The button will lead you to PayPal, a safe way of processing your payment. Please mention “Dragobete” in your memo.

This ritual will not be repeated again this year.
results.name: Love ritual of Dragobete

urtoolshop.com is New Jerseys 1st and only tool consignment shop franchisor.  Come join us as John Gibson, owner, explains  exactly how a tool consignment shop works. .  Everything from simple screwdrivers to industrial Backhoe Diggers pass through their doors .  Plumbers, electricians, painters, auto mechanics and all other trades can their extra tools into cash by consignment or find great deals on tools for much less then the cost of buying new.  Why pay the high cost of a new tool when you can buy a slightly used tool for half the cost?  Consigning with urtoolshop.com is easy and takes away all of the stress and work of selling your tools yourself.  You can drop tools at their shop or schedule a full house pickup and they will even do the packing and shipping.  Mr. Gibson has proven that their business model works for the untapped used tool market and will explain how he has opened up a unique opportunity for others to become a franchisee of urtoolshop.com.

Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

results.description:
Professionals Exchanging Ideas and Referrals (PEIR), is an independent networking group of business professionals dedicated to the business growth and success of each of our members.  We meet in Berkeley Heights, NJ; our members represent businesses from the surrounding 15 mile radius. 

We are currently seeking new affiliates in business categories not represented by our present membership.  Note - we are not about handing out business cards, but rather we are about building trusted business relationships and sharing business acumen.  Think networking PLUS a mastermind  group.  Please "opt-out" if not serious about a long-term professional relationship.

• We generally meet on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday mornings of the month (8:30am to 10:00am) with periodic evening networking and social events.

• We expect regular attendance at meetings, but understand that business (and life) will occasionally “trump” your attendance. 

• We seek legitimate business referrals and opportunities, and recognize these do not arise weekly.  Members should be “givers” as well as “takers”. 

• Our semi-annual dues are utilized for networking and member-only presentations and development. 

The following business areas are currently represented:

• Insurance – Property, Casualty & Life

• Mortgage Broker - Residential & Commercial

• Financial Advisor – Planning, Investments, Life, LTD, & LTC, Employee Benefits

• Residential Realtor

• Attorney – Business /  Real Estate / Estate Planning

• Web Design / e-Marketing / Graphic Design

• Title Insurance – Residential/Commercial

• Property Restoration -  Fire, Water, Smoke

• Interior Design -  residential & commercial

Examples of businesses we are seeking to join us (not all-inclusive):

Architect - Banking -  Business Consultant – Commercial Lender - Commercial Realtor - Contractor - CPA/Tax Practitioner - Florist – Handyman – Health & Fitness Professionals - Photographer – Printer - Recruiter

To register and purchase tickets for this event, click here.

Lean Startup Labs isn’t just another business conference. Inspired by feedback from you, Lean Startup community, we’ve created a series of regional events intended to host a smaller audience and meet you where you live. 

The series kicks off in New York city on February 24-25 with the Enterprise Summit, created for people working in enterprise companies and large, complex organizations. Labs are designed to get you thinking and working while you’re with us, and provide you with real tools to take with you when you leave. That’s why we’re keeping Enterprise Summit attendance limited to 200. We want you to be able to connect with fellow attendees, get exposed to new ideas, and get real advice from our amazing speakers on how to make Lean Startup work for you.

The Lean Startup team has carefully curated the program topics, inspired by community feedback and expert advisors who are actively working in the enterprise world. We’ve chosen speakers who will share pragmatic insights on how they’ve applied Lean Startup in their own organizations. They’ll share best practices on everything from designing an experiment to designing a Lean Startup culture.

results.description:
I hope you can join us for the first Westchester Journalists Freelance Meetup. Future meetings will have more structure, but the purpose of this first meeting is to get a sense of where we all are, and what general topics are most of interest to us right now. We'll start by talking a little about the kind of work we each do, or want to do, and we may talk about goals for places we'd like to pitch in the coming year. If you can, come armed with one problem you're facing right now. It could be figuring out where to pitch an idea, or how to structure a pitch, or how to take a vague idea and hone it into something sharper. It could be trying out a different kind of writing, or it could be a specific reporting problem.


Other topics potentially of interest for this or a future meeting: tips for brainstorming (I have a few, and I'd love to hear more); how to structure your day to tackle working from home and/or working on multiple projects; and swapping stories about cold pitches. We may discuss tips for writers starting out, or coming back to writing after a hiatus, or trying to break into a new kind of outlet. Other topics of interest, possibly, for some point down the road: networking; writing/reporting on spec; tackling isolation; balancing the kind of writing you want to do with writing that pays (more of) the bills.  


This is a safe and supportive group. We'll strive to help each other. Since people are very busy, I will start on time and end after an hour -- though, of course, folks are welcome to stay at the lovely cafe as long as they like.
results.name: An hour of coffee and talk

DESCRIPTION :

Our postnatal vinyasa class will gently help recondition the postpartum body and create physical, mental and emotional ease and confidence as you reconnect with your own self and your baby. In this sacred, nurturing environment moms can "take a break" to reset and focus on themselves, interact with other like-minded moms and bond with their little one. Learn simple and effective techniques for baby such as massage to comfort and aid in digestion/trapped air, gentle stretches and calming cradling holds. Mommies and babies alike will feel rejuvenated, relaxed and restored!

• no experience necessary — just show up!

• welcome to Moms and/or Dads, caretakers or grandparents

• baby ages : up to early crawlers, within reason

• Moms : be sure to get clearance from your doctor to begin gentle exercise again

• elevator access with stroller parking in the studio

• limited street parking available

• 4 blocks from Harsimus Cove Light Rail Station (by BJ's)


BRING : your baby (optional), yoga mat (if you'd rather use your own), baby necessities (ex. bobby pillow or blanket) and water. Wear comfy clothes you can move in easily.

results.description:
The New York City Economic Development Corporation (NYC EDC) and B Lab have launched the Best for NYC program to celebrate and support businesses that positively influence their workers, their community, and the environment. Participants are asked to take the "challenge" and fill out a brief survey about their business practices. Those who participate will be recognized by the city in an online and print directory, and will have access to special events and other benefits. 

In this workshop, the EDC will present details about the program and guide participants through the process of filling out the challenge. By the end of this workshop, we hope that everyone attending will be signed up and eligible for the program. 

Goodnik has partnered with the Impact Hub NYC , the Centre for Social Innovation, and Be Social Change to host these workshops because because we support and promote socially responsible business practices and want to encourage all our members to do business in a better way. You don't need to attend the workshop to take the challenge - take it on your own today!

TAKE THE BEST FOR NYC CHALLENGE


Special benefits for Goodnik members who take the challenge;

• A "service grant" of 100 goodnikels, to be used for 10 hours of professional services at Goodnik.net.

• Free tickets to Be Social Change events and 20% off BSC classes through March 15, 2016

• One week of free coworking at the Centre for Social Innovation or Impact Hub NYC for non-members

• Exclusive events and parties


• Inclusion in ‘Best for NYC’ Guide (print & digital), reaching 150,000+

• Exclusive events and services

• The opportunity to be featured in citywide awards and press*

• Membership in a vibrant networking community

• Ability to use ‘Best for NYC’ participant logo

• Tools to benchmark performance and create improvement plans

.
results.name: Best for NYC Workshop

results.description:
CiviDay is the annual celebration of all things CiviCRM. Join us as we work and learn together. More than 10,464 organisations around the world use CiviCRM every day to further their missions — yours could be one of them!

The CiviDay 2016 event is targeted to:

* End-users of CiviCRM who want to learn more about its functionality or get help with specific functions; and
* Decision-makers within non-profit organizations or civic associations who are curious about CiviCRM’s capabilities.

This year we will learn together with an afternoon of co-working. Come get help with any challenges that might be slowing things down for your organization. Very often, there is a solution available through CiviCRM!

In the evening we’ll have several presentations, including:

* Tadpole’s Dana Skallman’s basic introduction on using CiviCRM for your Constituent Relationship Management
* National Urban League's Lisa Taliano will share how CiviCase is used with new CaseType ACL hooks recently developed by Core included in the latest realease of CiviCRM 4.7
* Tadpole's Kevin Cristiano will demo an extension that helps theming in WordPress

DATE

24th February 2016

TIME

1pm - 5pm Civi Co-Working Afternoon

6pm – 7pm Presentation and Discussions

7pm – 8pm Networking Time

LOCATION

120 Wall Street, 8th Floor, New York, NY

Register here: https://civicrm.org/civicrm/event/register?id=782&reset=1

results.description:
Attention Life Transformers! in Lieu of feeling love in the air, I am making this week's call completely FREE! Simply send an email to [masked] saying "attending free webinar" and you'll receive an access code!



Do you often find yourself having little control over your emotions?

Do you experience anxiety and want to overcome it?

Do you act impulsively and later regret your actions?

If you answered "yes" to any of the questions above, this meditation is for YOU!

"Thoughts," according Buddhist monk Matthieu Ricard, "can be our best friends and our worst enemies."

Osho Says, "the mind can be a beautiful servant, or a dangerous master." 

In this guided meditation call, we will learn how to observe our own thoughts and cultivate the space between our thoughts. This space is often referred to as nirvana, ecstasy, and enlightenment.  When we enter this space we have total control over our emotions and actions. 


Until what is on the inside - that is, your mind - is corrected, the external world, that is, how you perceive and experience the world around you will be a mere reflection of it.

We will learn an ancient 5,000 year old Vedic technique taught by Indian enlightened master Paramahamsa Nithyananda, called "unclutching." In this technique we learn how to master our thoughts, and as a result control our emotions. 

Join me on this enlightening 45 minute experience! 

In love and abundance, 

Ayelet Shimron 

http://ayeletshimron.com/

www.Facebook.com/Ayelet.Shimron


[masked]-GOAL 

Testimonials from previous Life Transformers:

"Ayelet gave me a major breakthrough! I will be using the techniques we were taught to bring forth all this new power I have. I now feel as though this power is already here and now fully available to me, and I will use it to melt away my hesitation, doubts and fears. It's as though I am warping time to manifest the best version of who I will become. Thank you Ayelet!" -Ricardo, New Jersey 

"I listened to your webinar today from the UK and I must say that I love the way you broke it down! I've done all this reading / learning and no one does it your way. I haven't come across anyone who breaks it up into mini pieces that make sense. Normally I'm left confused, everyone [else] guides you with what to do, they just don't explain how to do it. Again thank you so much." - Natasha, U.K.

"I met Ayelet at a Meditation that she was leading. It was a very transformative experience. I didn't know what to expect. Well, less than ten minutes in I started crying and I didn't know how to stop. The tears just kept flowing. By the end of it, I felt like I let go of my anxiety and my fears of never being good enough.

The meditation helped me get through my break up immensely, and not only that, I fixed my constantly dysfunctional relationship with my parents as well. I feel like I've become more confident and let go of many of my fears.

Ayelet is definitely an authentic and go-to person when it comes to improving relationships. The meditation she led was life changing for me."- Annie Yang, NYC

If you've been wondering how to add some humor to your presentations, whether formal or informal, come to a meeting of Humorous Toastmasters.  This is a "specialty" club - open to anyone interested in joining, but which specializes in encouraging experimentation with humor in every aspect of the meeting, from introductions to prepared speeches.  As our club president used to say, we're not funny people, we're people trying to become funnier.

For more information about Toastmasters program, go to www.Toastmasters.org

Join us for the Open Entrepreneur Pitching Event for Digital Media, High Tech and Healthcare Start-Ups

Every Entrepreneur Gets a Table - We Bring the Investors to You!

Now with more Investors than ever! Every Start-Up gets to pitch to our team of Investors - the audience gets to find out what's new in the Start-Up market, and what VC's are really looking for!

Startup Pitching 6:00 - 9:00 pm

After more than 10 years of helping selected Entrepreneurs raise capital - we've figured how to open it up to everyone!

This innovative event gives every Entrepreneur a shot at getting the attention of Angel Investors on the lookout for new deals. Tech & Digital Media VCs and execs get a unique opportunity to survey the marketplace at their own pace.

Startupalooza is a unique pitching contest where all start ups are ranked by a large group on Investors. The Top 4 get to do a public "pitch-off" and the winner gets up to $4500 in prizes.

Free Capital Raising Workshop - February 17th (Different Location)
By popular demand, we have added our Capital Raising Workshop one week prior to the event. It rums from 6:00 - 8: 30 and itis Free if you sign up for Startupalooza (Microsoft 677 5th Ave @ 53rd St)


Our Current & Previous Group of Investors Include:

Errol Glasser, Triangle Capital 
Mike Segal, Joshua Capital 
Josh Bruno, Bain Capital Ventures

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will ever experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere. 

The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about, plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a couple blocks away.

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment!

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com
results.name: The Friendliest NYC After Work Happy Hour & Social Networking Party ~ Free Event
