results.description:
In this talk, Christopher Liljenstolpe will discuss the benefits of having an intent-centric policy model providing both connectivity and network security services for Apache Mesos environments.  He will cover the general benefits, as well as how Project Calico delivers on such a model.

Christopher Liljenstolpe is the Director Solutions Architecture at Metaswitch & Evangelist at Project Calico.rior roles have included Solution Archtiect BigSwitch Networks, Director of Architecture for architecture, networks, and services at Telstra, Chief Architect, Cable & Wireless, CTO for the IP Division, APAC for Alcatel-Lucent, and L3 architect for Woven Systems. Mr. Liljenstolpe co-chairs the Operations Area Working Group in the IETF, and has spoken widely on IP, MPLS, and network operational issues in various standards fora and conferences.
results.name: An IP for every container,  networking and security for Apache Mesos

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Do you have a film you think is festival ready? Join us for an evening of secrets (and harsh realities) behind the film festival circuit. 

Learn what to do--and what not to do--at your first, fifth, or fiftieth film festival. 

Come prepared to ask questions and engage with veteran filmmakers, film strategists and festival programmers as they explore the reasons, rationales, and realities to the world of preparing, submitting and programming for the film festival experience.

We are pleased to welcome to our panelists Terra Renee (Founder and President of African American Women In Cinema Organization, Inc.), Ingrid Jean-Baptiste (Founder & Director, Chelsea Film Festival), Gabrielle Kelly (Filmmaker, Producer, and Strategist), and Jim Jermanok (Award-winning writer, director, and producer).
results.how_to_find_us: The Adorama Event Space
results.name: The Art of the Film Festival: Getting The Most Out of Your Experience

results.description:
Join us as we launch the “Supreme Court Watch” series with a preview of United States v. Texas.  Later this year, we will discuss several more major cases before the high court this term.

Since immigration is a central issue in the 2016 presidential race and the media is trying hard to muddle the water, we will also examine the positions of the top three Republican candidates: Trump, Cruz and Rubio.

Sheila will share the arguments she presented on immigration and on the constitutionality of executive actions when she debated against liberal lawyers and spoke to conservative audiences.


Time permitting, we will have our usual free-flowing conversations after the discussion on the case and the candidates.

-------------------------------------

The questions before the Supreme Court:

 (1) Whether a state that voluntarily provides a subsidy to all aliens with deferred action has Article III standing and a justiciable cause of action under the Administrative Procedure Act (APA) to challenge the Secretary of Homeland Security’s guidance seeking to establish a process for considering deferred action for certain aliens because it will lead to more aliens having deferred action.

 (2) Whether the guidance is arbitrary and capricious or otherwise not in accordance with law.

(3) Whether the guidance was subject to the APA’s notice-and-comment procedures.

(4) Whether the guidance violates the Take Care Clause of the Constitution, Article II, section 3.
results.name: February Monthly Meetup + Supreme Court Watch #1: Executive Amnesty

Join us on February 24th when Chief MarTech Scott Brinker, will present data and analysis from his Technology Conferences on the latest on the landscape of Marketing Technology and what to expect in 2016 and beyond.  


We will open our discussion with Margaret Molloy, Global CMO of Siegel & Gale, who will share her views of B2B trends she is seeing with global companies in marketing and simplicity.

MO-CCA Operations Board member Jon Russo of B2B Fusion will kick our meeting off.

Come network with professionals just like you!

results.description:
Register HERE (do not register on meetup.com)


Create Native iOS Applications in Java with RoboVM - Joseph Hager (Xamarin)

Use Java 8 features on iOS???  Building the same mobile application for both iOS and Android can be tricky. With different development tools and ecosystems, it is difficult to share code and best practices in a team.  It would be really cool if you could use Java, Scala, Kotlin or other JVM languages to build your mobile apps.  RoboVM is a tool that allows you to build Java 8 applications that run natively on iPads and iPhones (and Android too btw) without using JNI. Share code, tools, libraries and best practices all in Java.

From Imperative to Reactive Programming - Rossen Stoyanchev (Pivotal)

By now you've probably heard about Reactive Streams, RxJava, and reactive programming. The change to reactive however involves much more than just learning a new API or using a hot new library. It involves a fundamental shift in the way application logic is written from imperative to non-blocking. This talk explains what the change from imperative to non-blocking means and demonstrates through examples how to use reactive libraries to compose asynchronous application logic. We will also focus on explaining the role of the Reactive Streams specification for interop among non-blocking libraries and components.

You must register HERE
results.name: Native iOS Apps in Java -and- Introduction to Reactive Programming

Check out a new workshop event on Wednesday, February 24 from 6-9pm to learn how to reach your next 100 customers with the latest DIY tools (including video marketing!), and hear practical case-studies presented by your peers from Animoto, Wix, BarkBox, Piktochart, and SplashThat. Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!


Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. 

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

</a> Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and <a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com">www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: The Friendliest NYC After Work Happy Hour & Social Networking Party ~ Free Event

group.name: New York Social Network, Events and Adventure Group - NYC

results.description:
Hey everyone!  

On Wednesday, February 24th, the New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce will be hosting a mixer in Hudson County, at Porta Jersey City.  With great food and a great, hipster vibe, Porta Jersey City is the North Jersey sibling to Porta Asbury Park. 

Porta is an authentic Neapolitan pizza restaurant that has received raves from The New York Times, The Newark Star-Ledger, Travel + Leisure, Refinery29 and The Examiner.


Meet new friends and make business connections in Hudson County.

The board of directors of the Chamber will be there to make introductions and get the ball rolling.  Ask us about LGBT Business certification and bring business cards.  We will be raffling off a one-year membership to the Chamber!


Getting here is easy!   If you come by the Path train get off at the Grove Street stop.  If you're driving you can park on the street or pull into the Grove Pointe/Central Parking garage at 100 Christopher Columbus Drive.  The Path station and the garage are both just a 2 minute walk to Porta.  So join us.  And bring a friend.

                      IT PAYS TO BE A MEMBER OF THE CHAMBER!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet Us At The Bar!
results.name: Meet Us In Jersey City!

group.name: New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
results.name: FREE West African Dance Class!!

group.name: Free and Affordable Yoga, Meditation, African Dance Classes

results.description:
While many of us know Excel, corporate finance and accounting, bringing the three together into a three-statement financial model is often another step altogether. This evening’s speaker is John S. Tjia, author of “Building Financial Models” (McGraw-Hill, 2009, 2nd edition) and currently Executive Director in the Business Modeling group at Ernst & Young. John will  speak on “Accounting for Modeling” and will introduce the basics of how the income statement, balance sheet and cash flow statement are interlinked, and how the “cash sweep” works (using excess cash in the forecast to pay down debt). Afraid you will be out of your depth because the topic is “accounting”? Don’t worry—the session will bring you up the learning curve gently but effectively.

After his presentation, there will be a Q&A session. We will then have a raffle for an autographed copy of his book (please bring your business card to put into the raffle basket). Refreshments will be served. See you there!
results.name: Accounting for Modeling - Guest Speaker

group.name: Financial Modeling in Excel Meetup - New York

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

We usually have many more people who attend than who RSVP. We try to adjust the numbers on the Meetup to reflect that, but we err on the side of lowballing. As of Nov. 2015 we are averaging out around 25 people throughout the night though for special events we've had up to 80.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!

results.description:
Do you have a film you think is festival ready? Join us for an evening of secrets (and harsh realities) behind the film festival circuit. 

Learn what to do--and what not to do--at your first, fifth, or fiftieth film festival. 

Come prepared to ask questions and engage with veteran filmmakers, film strategists and festival programmers as they explore the reasons, rationales, and realities to the world of preparing, submitting and programming for the film festival experience.

We are pleased to welcome to our panelists Terra Renee (Founder and President of African American Women In Cinema Organization, Inc.), Ingrid Jean-Baptiste (Founder & Director, Chelsea Film Festival), Gabrielle Kelly (Filmmaker, Producer, and Strategist), and Jim Jermanok (Award-winning writer, director, and producer).
results.how_to_find_us: Adorama Camera story
results.name: The Art of the Film Festival: Getting The Most Out of Your Experience

Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consume something.


• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.

Our next InDesign User Group Meeting is scheduled for Wednesday, February 24 at 6:30 PM at Kean Hall, Kean University in Union, NJ. Free pizza will be served starting at 6:15 PM.

A Whole Evening of InDesign Print Production Features.

• Setting up a Custom Preflight Profile

• Finding the Right Settings for Exporting the Perfect PDF for Your Printer

• What Graphic Formats Work Best with InDesign. 

• An Inside Look at the Print Dialog Window

• The Ins and Outs of Packaging Your Finished Project Perfectly

• Color Profiling

• Using Print Booklet 

• And Lots More!

So if you’d like to be a Print Production Hero, this is the perfect meeting for you to attend. Please sign up today.

Looking forward to seeing you there.

Mary and Jeff

Mary Belthoff and Jeff Witchel
Adobe's Co-Representatives to the InDesign User Group of New Jersey

results.description:
Join us for an advanced screening of the upcoming Lionsgate action-film, Gods of Egypt on Wednesday, FEB 24 at the AMC 34th Street Theater. Show time is 7:00PM, but please arrive at the theater no later than 6:30PM to guarantee admission to the film.


More details here:

* scheduled to have a screening on Wed, Feb 24 at 7:00pm.  Get there by 6:15/6:30pm to guarantee admission

* we have 25 slots, so this is a NYC Dads Group members only event (Members will be allowed to RSVP with a +1)

* RSVP by wednesday morning at 11am, Feb 24, when we have to provide the final list

*Theater: AMC 34th Street 14. THEATER LOCATION IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE TO ANOTHER TIMES SQUARE LOCATION.


The screening company, Allied-THA will have a table set up, so members can just go inside to the Allied-THA table inside the theater.  

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GODS OF EGYPT

Wednesday, February 24th at 7:00PM (arrive by 6:30 pm)

AMC 34th St.

(312 W. 34th St., NYC)

SYNOPSIS: In this spectacular action-adventure inspired by the classic mythology of Egypt, the survival of mankind hangs in the balance as an unexpected mortal hero Bek (Brenton Thwaites) undertakes a thrilling journey to save the world and rescue his true love. In order to succeed, he must enlist the help of the powerful god Horus (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) in an unlikely alliance against Set (Gerard Butler), the merciless god of darkness, who has usurped Egypt’s throne, plunging the once peaceful and prosperous empire into chaos and conflict. As their breathtaking battle against Set and his henchmen takes them into the afterlife and across the heavens, both god and mortal must pass tests of courage and sacrifice if they hope to prevail in the epic final confrontation.

IN THEATERS FEBRUARY 26

TRAILER

results.description:
New to the Real Estate Investing arena?

Just getting your feet wet?

Have you done a deal but it didn’t turn out as you expected?

Over the years we've been assisting individuals become real estate investors, one of the most asked questions has been, "How Do I Get Started in Real Estate Investing?"

Sometimes real estate investing can be scary and it’s easy to get lost in all the books, blogs, seminars, and television gurus. Our main objective is to help you overcome your fears and your countless questions by providing as much education and hands on coaching as possible to help you make the best decisions for your own needs.

Knowledge is YOUR most important currency.

Why do the rich keep getting richer? Wealthy people simply do things differently. Money doesn't make people rich. Knowledge makes people rich.

Financial knowledge – which is never taught in school - can never be taken away from you. It gives you the ability to create cash flow for you and your family no matter what happens to the rest of the economy.

At this event, we will discuss various investment strategies with a focus on ways to create cash flow through real estate as well as other ways to make money in Real Estate. We will also introduce you to the same strategies and ways of thinking about money that successful entrepreneurs have consistently used to create wealth.

Everyone wants to be wealthy, but only a select few will ever TAKE ACTION and get the financial knowledge they need to make their dreams come true. You can be part of the few elite people that choose to Take Action! Your First Step to Financial Freedom is to register for this event.

Choose ACTION. Create SUCCESS.

When will you begin??
results.how_to_find_us: Journal Square - Jersey City
results.name: Learn Real Estate Investing Basics

results.description:
Prepayment</a> is required at <a href="http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994">http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment required at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994 required
results.name: Speed BOWLING NYC- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

results.description:
Are you tired of just working your day to day grind and jusgetting by? Why not find out how you can get out of the rat race?

The game of Cashflow simulates real-life financial management and features realistic Real Estate investing scenarios designed to show you how these types of transactions work in real life and both helps you learn how to effectively utilize them in their investing strategies. It also helps to find out your investing style, whether you are aggressive in your strategies or conservative so we can see in which of these you are most comfortable. All without the pressures of using your own money.

We will be meeting at a cafe/restaurant in Astoria

results.description:
Prepayment is required at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment required at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994 required

results.description:
Join us at one of the coolest lounges in NYC for an evening of networking and drinks with many of the best Entrepreneurs NYC has to offer!

Atmosphere: 
- The dress code is Business Casual. 
- We will provide name tags for everyone that attends. We ask that you put your name and industry on your name tag. 
- Make sure you bring enough business cards.

Time is Precious: 
- Event is from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM. Please make an effort to come on time so everyone benefits but feel free to stay as long as you like.

Admission: 
- FREE for the First 900 RSVP on Meetup 
- $20 for everyone else

Drinks: 
- 2 drink norm, 1 drink min. Because the venue is turning away other business to allow us to host our event, all our networking events require a "2 drink norm, 1 drink minimum!"

***Since this is a drinking establishment, all attendees must be 21+.***

***************************
EVENT SPONSOR:


For those who want extra exposure at our events you can do so by becoming a sponsor.  As a courtesy we only accept one sponsor in each industry. Benefits of becoming a sponsor are: your company name, link to your website, and a short company description will be include in the event page and our emails.

 CLICK HERE TO RESERVE YOUR SPONSOR SPOT NOW! 

***************************

Venue Sponsor: 
We are constantly looking for new and exciting venues to use.  If you have a venue and you would like us to consider using it please contact Trang at Trang [masked].

**************************************** 
SPAM:

Please don't spam our members in the comment section with your company name/website because your message will be deleted and you will be ban from the group.

results.description:
Intro for this event: Come see examples of how today's large data collections are being tackled by data science and machine learning methods, thereby empowering a data-driven transformation in organizations and industries that is bringing about greater competitive intelligence, insights, and innovation.

Speaker Bio: Dr. Kirk Borne is the Principal Data Scientist for NextGen Analytics and Data Science in the Strategic Innovation Group at Booz Allen Hamilton. He previously spent 12 years as Professor at George Mason University in the Computational and Data Sciences program. Before that, he worked 18 years on various NASA contracts, as research scientist and as manager on large data systems. He has a PhD in Astrophysics from Caltech. He has applied his expertise in science and data systems as a consultant and advisor to numerous agencies and firms, focusing on the use of data for discovery, decision support, and innovation across many different domains and industries. He is an active contributor of data science and analytics information on social media, where he has been named consistently among the top worldwide influencers in big data and data science. Follow him on Twitter at @KirkDBorne Agenda: Kirk will first briefly describe the $200K 2016 Data Science Bowl Kaggle Competition that is sponsored by Booz Allen Hamilton. And then he will give an example of how to use machine learning methods in novel ways to extract value and discoveries from today's large data sets.

Content: (1) Data Science Bowl 2016: Transforming How We Diagnose Heart Disease; and (2) Clustering Techniques and Applications: From Validation to Value.


Reference: http://rocketdatascience.org/
results.name: Expert Series: Kirk Borne, Principal Data Scientist of Booz Allen Hamilton

results.description:
Topic

Are you a web developer that wants to use ASP.NET and haven’t because you want to run on Linux or OSX? In this demo filled session lead by one of the ASP.NET program managers we will show: step-by-step instructions of how to get ASP.NET Core running on a Mac or Linux, how to get the most out of Linux and .NET when writing new code with our favorite Linux editors and we will build out production quality ASP.NET resources running on docker. At the conclusion of this session you’ll have everything you need to collaborate with your friends coding ASP.NET on Windows.

Speaker

Jeffrey T. Fritz is a senior program manager in Microsoft’s Development Division that delivers Visual Studio and the .NET development platform. As a long time web developer with experience in large and small applications across a variety of verticals, he knows how to build for performance and practicality. He is the author of the book, ‘Learn ASP.NET Core in 24 Hours’ and leads the ASP.NET 4.x and NuGet teams. You can also learn from Jeffrey on Pluralsight, Wintellect, follow him on twitter @csharpfritz, and read his blogs at jeffreyfritz.com and blogs.msdn.com/webdev

This meeting will be held at the Microsoft offices as usual. Check the Meetup site for details!
results.how_to_find_us: Central Park West (6th Floor, Room #6501)
results.name: Developing and Running ASP.NET on LINUX with .NET Core

results.description:
Half of women report feelings of self-doubt about their careers and performance.


Naomi Hirabayashi and Marah Lidey of Shine Text are doing something about that.

You might know Naomi and Marah from their work at DoSomething.org, where they've been since 2011 and 2012 respectively.

Now they're on a new mission: help women, and all working professionals 21-45, slay the day with confidence tips, work hacks and humor.

Join us on Wednesday, February 24th at 6:30 at the TekServe Studio as Naomi and Marah discuss their new projects, the confidence gap, and how women (and men) in the nonprofit world can crush their self-doubt.
results.how_to_find_us: C, E, F, M, N, R, or 1 train to 23rd St.
results.name: Conquering the Confidence Gap with Texts - Shine Text Founders

results.description:
We know that a large number of organizations are using AWS or are planning to. We also know that hackers are targeting organization’s AWS infrastructure. What you may not know, is how hackers are doing this and what you can do about it.


Join us as Ken Johnson, CTO of nVisium, discusses harnessing existing AWS functionality to strengthen your organization’s AWS infrastructure against practical attacks. Ken will show you what attackers are looking for, how they are finding you, how to secure your environment, and how to answer the question “Our access keys have been stolen, what do we do now?”.


Speaker info: Ken leads nVisium's product development efforts and is responsible for the security of engineering infrastructure and code. Ken co-built the Railsgoat project, an open-source security-centric training platform for Ruby on Rails developers, and is a frequent speaker on both security and development topics - DevOpsDays DC, LASCON, AppSec Cali, OWASP DC, RubyNation.
results.name: It's 10pm, Do You Know Where Your Access Keys Are?

results.description: I apologize--I really dropped the ball on this! We had been making our way through the short stories and it's time for a personal favorite! The Adventure of the Copper Beeches introduces us to a a fascinating client (Violet Hunter) and takes us out of London, which allows reflection on both the city and its surrounding areas. The venue for this a a casual, 24-hour joint with a sort of grocery store and food court. They sell everything from fresh ramen to British sweets to bottles of beer. We'd ask that everyone make a purchase of some sort, even just a tea or coffee, so we are not vagrants in the space, then join us upstairs for a discussion! (Warning: the cupcakes are deceptively good-looking, you do not actually want one!) Feel free to join us if you have not read the story, but if you are interested it is available on line for free!
results.name: Copper Beaches Discussion

results.description:
Get Full Details & Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-tagine-nyc.html

Speed Dating - Ages 30 to 44 (Must Pre Pay Online)

(THIS IS NOT AN ASIAN SPECIFIC EVENT)

When: Wednesday, February 24th, 2016
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check in at 6:20)
Where: Tagine Lounge  (221 West 38th St.New York, NY - Between 7th & 8th Ave)

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup.

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 7 and 15 mini dates each lasting between four and eight minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-tagine-nyc.html

* There is a one drink minimum at the event. If you don't drink alcohol, you're welcome to order soda, juice or an item from the food menu.

http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/e/4/e/1/600_444658593.jpegFAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.


GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-tagine-nyc.html

results.description:
We are thrilled to host a Coder Career Series every other Wednesday at Byte Academy. The events will help attendees brush up on programming on-the-job or land that perfect job. Regulars range from people who recently learned how to code, to developers at the New York area's top technology companies. Cracking the Coding Interview (5th or 6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell will be followed. Although the event will break individuals into groups to discuss the topics of choice, this session’s focus is Chapter 16. Chapters are non-cumulative, and coders of all different skills and languages are welcome.

The event will kick off with an optional half-hour Meet and Greet with refreshments.  Problem solving starts at 7 pm.  The series will run every other Wednesday and is a joint event with the Fin-Tech Meetup, http://www.meetup.com/Byte-Academy-Finance-and-Technology-community/.

About Byte Academy: Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)
results.name: Algorithms and Interview Prep at Byte Academy

results.description:
Date: Wednesday, February 24, 2016 

Time: 6:30pm-7:30pm then 7:40pm-8:40pm then 8:50pm-9:50pm (3 separate sessions) 

Location: Fairway Studios - 115 W. 30th Street between 6th and 7th Avenue 

Price: (NEW 2 PAYMENT PROCESS!!!!!!)

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING


This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

group.name: Volumetric Society of NYC - 3D, Telematics, Kinect, Emotiv +

results.description:
Welcome to

The Health and Wellness Network of Commerce Corp. -Manhattan Chapter

With Chapter President Reed Prescott

Our mission is to provide a platform for health and wellness professionals, practitioners, service and product providers to network with corporate professionals while providing a sustainable support system for both.

You Asked For It, You Got It!

A place where health and wellness professionals, practitioners and service providers meet corporate professionals leading sustainable businesses while supporting each other. A place where like-minded people come to learn, grow and thrive in these economic times by standing out and helping others along the way.

We invite you to join this Amazing Health and Wellness Network of Commerce Manhattan Networking Event.

When? Wednesday, February 24th, 2016.

What Time? 6:30 PM to 9 PM

Where? At Dallas BBQ, 261 8th Avenue (Corner of 23rd Street) In Manhattan, NY

Cost? This Event is FREE for Members of the Health and Wellness Network of Commerce * For None Members and Guests * $20 Online * $25 at the door

Tell your Friends because we are Making a Splash in the industry and you want to be a part of it.

Space is Limited So Please Reserve Your Seat Today!

This Month's Featured Speaker is Orly Amor, Founder of the Health and Wellness Network of Commerce International

results.description:
The next Pints 'n' Purls Meetup will be at The Bar at Whole Foods in Columbus Circle from 6:30-9:30 p.m., so drop in anytime you like. Bring your knitting, crocheting, cross-stitching, or whatever else you're working on and prepare for a blast!

I am not sure if this is up to date, but here is the beer <a>menu: http://www.beermenus.com/places/1868-whole-foods-market-columbus-circle</a>;

The bar is on the right past the registers.  Lots of food options!

Feel free to call Deborah ( 914/[masked] )  or Amy ( 347/[masked] ) with any questions. Hope to see you there!

Feel free to come earlier and grab a table.  With our schedules, we can't guarantee an organizer can make it there earlier than 6:30.

We hope that you will consider becoming or renewing your status as a "Pints 'n' Purls Contributor."  These voluntary dues help cover the costs of running the group, which include dues to Meetup.com, prizes for events, thank yous for hosts, etc.   ALL the money goes back into the group.  We are just hoping that you will share in some of the expenses that come out of organizing these fun and friendly events.  You can pay online or in person ($24/year We organize over 70 meetups a year.)
results.how_to_find_us: We are generally at a large table in the back of the restaurant section. Ask the staff if you don't see us- they know where to find us.
results.name: On Tap (the Bar) at Whole Foods Columbus Circle

venue.address_1: 11 Times Square (NE Corner of 41st St and 8th Ave)
venue.name: Microsoft

results.description:
Microsoft released a health band in 2014 supported by iOS, Android, and Windows Phone 8+. Very few devices offer cross platform support, thus creating a desirable wearable. In this session we will discuss the various features available in each phone platform using the new APIs available. By the end of this session the attendee should understand what they can and cannot do in the Microsoft Band APIs.

Speaker: Becky Isserman

Becky has been a SharePoint developer and consultant since 2005, architecting out-of-the-box and custom-developed solutions for multiple clients in federal and commercial verticals. Her love of technology began at the St Louis Science Center, which she would visit just to use the Kid Pix, Eliza, and Hangman programs on their computers. At age 15, she started building websites in AOLPress and then Notepad. She is active in the New York City Developer Community and is a frequent speaker at events and user groups, from the Microsoft SharePoint Conference to SharePoint Saturdays to Code Camps. She was named a Microsoft SharePoint Server MVP in 2011 and 2012. She is a former organizer of SharePoint Saturday NYC and currently helps assist Code Camp NYC.


Pizza will be provided courtesy of Xamarin
results.how_to_find_us: 6th Floor, Radio City
results.name: The New Fitness API on the Block

results.description:
*THERE IS A MANDATORY $15 MINIMUM PURCHASE OF FOOD OR DRINK AT THIS EVENT*

*

Let's grab a bite to eat, maybe some drinks, and play some games! Yes, there are games you may never have heard of ... Splendor, Saboteur, Survive - Escape From Atlantis, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Suburbia and many many more!! Not to worry! People who bring the games will teach you how to play.  If you have a game you want to play, bring it along! 


We will get there between 6 and 6:30, have a bite to eat and then bring out the games!!  But, if you can't get there until later, no problem.  We'll be there for several hours.   Don't want to eat dinner there?  No problem, you can order some drinks.  Just keep in mind ... each attendee is required to purchase at least $15 of food or drinks.

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play,  feel free to ask.  And again, if you want to bring one of your own games, that's cool too!  As a matter of fact, it's encouraged!  ;-)
results.name: Board Games and Dinner!

results.description:
Happy New Year, everyone!

For 2016, the NYC DAM Meetup Group is branching out with a new type of event. Please join for an inaugural meeting of a discussion-style event. 

Through these events, we aim to connect the membership directly with each other and provide a forum to share questions, describe challenges and brainstorm solutions members may be wrestling with in their day to day with DAM.

This first discussion will be focused on one of the core classics - DAM and Taxonomy and Metadata!

Please stay tuned as we will be reaching out to collect any burning questions, concerns or sub-topic ideas you're looking to explore. Or, bring your ideas (and your ears!) to the event itself.

We look forward to seeing you - and hearing from you - in February!

Agenda

6:30-6:45 - Arrival

6:45-7 - Introductions / Housekeeping / Rules of the Road / Topic Voting

7-8 - Roundtable discussion(s) re: DAM, Metadata & Taxonomy
results.name: Discussion: DAM and Taxonomy & Metadata

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 30 singles will be attending! 

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins.  A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1T51dlm

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1Q60bjM

What's included:

• Free Bowling Games, Shoe Rental & Scorecard Matching 

• Snacks & Ice Breakers

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Grey Goose Drink Specials 

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1T51dlm

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1Q60bjM

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door 

Can I still attend even If I don't want to bowl?  Yes, you can still be a member of the team and mingle.  Food & Drink will also be available for purchase. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic specific?  This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event.  About 40 singles will be attending ages, mostly 20s-40s. But all are welcome 21+.

How do I attend?  RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.description:
Let's meetUp and talk about how to use Big Data to personalize education.


Bio

Dr. Angie McAllister is SVP of Personalized Learning & Analytics at Pearson where she and her team draw on the data and learning sciences to yield deep insights into student learning that can optimize learning outcomes and student success.

Angie holds a Ph.D. in Educational Leadership and has served for 25 years as a K-12 and university instructor, professional development specialist, school principal, and researcher focused on leadership, collaborative learning, conflict theory, learning analytics, adaptive learning, and mobile learning technologies. Her doctoral research focused on social learning theory and the role of conflict dispositions in collaborative learning models.

Angie lives in New York City.

results.description:
"Happy Half Hour": Byte Academy is so thrilled to host a Coder Career Series every other Wednesday with the Problem Solving Practice for Coders group at 7 pm that we are launching a break the ice "Happy Half Hour" at 6:30 pm before the group.  The idea of this will be for engineers of all levels (including bootcamp students) to mingle amongst light refreshments encouraging a  collegial,  "mentor type," collaborative atmosphere before practice begins.

If interested in being a Byte Academy mentor, please message [masked]

Algorithms and Interview Prep: The events will help attendees brush up on programming on-the-job or land that perfect job.  Regulars range from people who recently learned how to code, to developers at the New York area's top technology companies.

Cracking the Coding Interview (5th or 6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell will be followed.  Although the event will break individuals into groups to discuss the topics of choice, this session’s focus is Chapter 15.  Coders of all different skills and languages are welcome.

We will host this meet up group every other Wednesday which is a joint event with the Algorithms & Interview Prep Problem Solving Practice for Coders Meetup http://www.meetup.com/problemsolving/

About Byte Academy:  Byte Academy is an industry-focused coding bootcamp in the heart of Manhattan offering full and part-time programs emphasizing Python programming language. Programs include: fullstack Python development, FinTech (financial technology), Data Science and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy is the first coding camp in New York City to offer a full-time Python program and is the only in the world to teach FinTech. The school has small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events. Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive a $2,000 off tuition upon acceptance to the program. Through Byte Academy's Tuition-Deferral Program, qualified applicants pay $0 until they find a job. Byte Academy is now accepting applications for its Part-Time Fullstack Python, FinTech and Data Science Classes!

Follow Byte Academy: @byteacademyco (twitter) @byteacademy (facebook & instagram)

results.description:
Intro for this event: Come see examples of how today's large data collections are being tackled by data science and machine learning methods, thereby empowering a data-driven transformation in organizations and industries that is bringing about greater competitive intelligence, insights, and innovation.

Speaker Bio: Dr. Kirk Borne is the Principal Data Scientist for NextGen Analytics and Data Science in the Strategic Innovation Group at Booz Allen Hamilton. He previously spent 12 years as Professor at George Mason University in the Computational and Data Sciences program. Before that, he worked 18 years on various NASA contracts, as research scientist and as manager on large data systems. He has a PhD in Astrophysics from Caltech. He has applied his expertise in science and data systems as a consultant and advisor to numerous agencies and firms, focusing on the use of data for discovery, decision support, and innovation across many different domains and industries. He is an active contributor of data science and analytics information on social media, where he has been named consistently among the top worldwide influencers in big data and data science. Follow him on Twitter at @KirkDBorne 

Agenda: Kirk will first briefly describe the $200K 2016 Data Science Bowl Kaggle Competition that is sponsored by Booz Allen Hamilton. And then he will give an example of how to use machine learning methods in novel ways to extract value and discoveries from today's large data sets.

Content: 

(1) Data Science Bowl 2016: Transforming How We Diagnose Heart Disease; and 

(2) Clustering Techniques and Applications: From Validation to Value.


Reference: 

http://rocketdatascience.org/
results.name: Expert Series: Kirk Borne, Principal Data Scientist of Booz Allen Hamilton

results.description:
Get Full Details & Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-tagine-nyc.html

Speed Dating - Ages 30 to 44 (Must Pre Pay Online)

When: Wednesday, February 24th, 2016
6:30 PM - 8:30 PM (Check in at 6:20)
Where: Tagine Lounge  (221 West 38th St.New York, NY - Between 7th & 8th Ave)

PRICE: $34  (Must Pre-Pay Online. No Tickets Sold At Event Door)
(We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because once we fill up for a certain gender we will list event as sold out for that gender. Sign up now to secure your spot).

The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup.

EVENT DETAILS:
Speed dating is so much fun and a great way to meet quality, single professionals in the busy city of NYC. Most people know within a few minutes if they would like to see someone again. We may be biased but we definitely think this is a much better way to meet people than online dating or at a random bar.

You will go on between 7 and 15 mini dates each lasting between four and eight minutes each (we lengthen or shorten the date time according to how many people attend). Women stay seated and the men rotate from table to table until they meet each woman.

You will get a match card and at the end of each mini date you'll discreetly indicate whether or not you'd like to see the person again. At the end of the evening you will hand your match card in to the event host. If you both select each other, we will send you each others' email address the next day so you can set up a future date!

Get Your Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-tagine-nyc.html</a>

* There is a one drink minimum at the event. If you don't drink alcohol, you're welcome to order soda, juice or an item from the food menu.

FAQ:

WHAT IS THE DRESS CODE?
Please no sneakers, t-shirts or gym attire.

CAN I PAY AT THE EVENT DOOR?
We do no accept payment at the event door. You must pre-pay online.

WHEN WILL I GET MY MATCHES EMAILED TO ME?
We will email you matches within 48 hours after the event.

IS THERE A REFUND POLICY?
If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer refunds if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up.

WHO IS ATTENDING?
The RSVP list on this page is not an indication of actual event attendees. This event is being listed on over 10 different singles Meetup groups and also outside of Meetup. Most people attending are not from Meetup. You can feel free to RSVP page to let the group know you're attending but you still have to go to the above link to pay for the event.


GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.clickmixers.com/speed-dating-tagine-nyc.html
results.name: Speed Dating - Ages 30 to 44

results.description:
Prepayment is required at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles 

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works 
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT @ Prepayment required at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5994 

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

results.description:
Hello merry Meetup members! We’re coming out to the Big Apple and if you (or someone you know) are in the area, join us and spread the word!

**PLEASE REGISTER VIA THE EVENTBRITE PAGE!**

***The event is not full, see link above for registration info

Starting a company is easy. But scaling it is another matter. The education market is notorious for being a tough playground. Fortunately, there’s help. The US edtech industry has birthed many edtech accelerators that can connect entrepreneurs to mentors, investors, partners and teammates—along with educators who can help guide product development. Oh, there’s also access to early capital.

Accelerators can turn great concepts into great businesses. But with more than a dozen options on the scene, which one is right for you? Should you join an accelerator? How do you know if and when you’re ready to apply?

This event, sponsored by Intel Education Accelerator, will offer perspectives from a diverse group of stakeholders on whether these startups are ready to tackle the market—and whether they’re truly addressing pain points felt by teachers and learners.

EdSurge’s Senior Editor, MaryJo Madda will moderate the discussion. Panelists will be announced shortly!

Hors d'oeuvres, beer and wine will be served.

**PLEASE REGISTER VIA THE EVENTBRITE PAGE!**
results.name: Is an Edtech Accelerator Right For You? (NY event, Register via EventBrite!!)

group.name: The SF Edtech Meetup by EdSurge

results.description:
EVENT: Dining

DESCRIPTION:


Ramen is taking over. What was once a buzzy food just in big cities like New York, Los Angeles, and San Francisco is now popping up all over the country, including cities such as Philadelphia, Austin, and San Diego. Blame Momofuku’s noodley overlord David Chang, perhaps: it’s certainly no coincidence that a good number of the new ramen restaurants mimic the sleek wood aesthetic of his landmark New York restaurant Noodle Bar, and the ramen trend has only intensified after the first, ramen-themed first issue of Chang’s Lucky Peach was released in 2011.

“We aim to serve ramen that embraces a whole meal in one bowl,” explains Mr. Okayama about the spirit behind their ramen. Zen 6 really expands the concept of ramen and elevates this cuisine to the next level. It’s a ramen shop for the next generation.

MENU:
http://zen6ny.com/our-menu/

FOOD PORN:
• Ramen Burger? OMG Your so sexy


• Tan Tan 6: This ramen highlights their masterfully crafted, medium thick straight noodles and soup combining chicken and tonkotsu broths to get just the right richness. Fried garlic and house-made maayu (roasted garlic oil) add extra body and nuttiness to the spicy soup and conventional tan tan men meat sauce while an abundance of fresh vegetables balances out the layering flavors. Mix well before eating!

• Hakata Tonkotsu Ramen: The golden combination of firm, straight noodles and a rich and full-bodied tonkotsu broth is enlivened in this traditional Hakata style tonkotsu ramen. Inspired by the famous Ippudo tonkotsu ramen, Zen 6 has perfected their soup with a milder and smoother taste that goes well with their original maayu.

• Spider Ramen: Oversized soft shell crab sitting on the ramen brings a happy feeling to your stomach and taste buds. A medley of flavors come one after another when you bite into this umami-packed and texture-filled dish. The chicken and tonkotsu blended soup mildly embrace a whole lot of flavors.

• Taj Mahal Ramen: Curry meets ramen, making this the marriage of the king and queen of Japanese comfort foods. The curry flavor is reserved to highlight their chicken base broth and is just enough to add an energizing aroma and a kick to the dish. Medium thick straight noodles absorb the soup well, and crisp, fresh bean sprouts and scallions display comfortable harmony with the original meat paste.

RESTAURANT GALLERY:
• Dining Room


• The Bar


RESTAURANT REVIEW:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/zen-6-new-york

Your RSVP of "Yes" on the event page or attendance of an event signifies your full understanding and acceptance of the terms of this liability waiver. We reserve the rights to limit this event to physically fit people.

END

results.description:
Which aromas energize? Increase focus? Ease stress? Arouse creativity? Learn from a Clinical Psychologist, Dr. Goddard. See, smell, touch, taste, receive samples of the aromas in this interactive workshop. 

Experience for yourself the enchantment, inspiration and creativity of essential aromas. Mother Nature is unrivaled when it comes to Creativity. 

We invite you to meet Dr. Paul Goddard, Clinical Psychologist in the creative atmosphere of the Soho Photo Gallery. Immerse yourself in a sensory experience. Come to better understand the power of your amazing sense of smell. Perhaps you remember the aroma of fresh baked bread or chocolate chip cookies fresh from the oven. Learn about gifts of the earth that awaken creativity: savor herbal tea, experience essential oils, embrace aromatherapy techniques that many find indispensable to remain grounded and creative amidst the commotion of city life.

Mother Nature loves Creativity - she inspires us with so many sights, sounds, smells, flavors and sensations.
Our ability to breathe and smell is profoundly evocative.
Fragrance is a subtle but very powerful pathway to creativity.

Even long ago, the geniuses knew about the power of fragrances. Leonardo da Vinci was said to be passionate about essential oils, and was famed for surrounding himself with perfumes. Even Shakespeare's father was a glover who was known to use extensive amounts of essential oils. Could this have been a contributing factor to the creation of 39 plays, 154 sonnets and countless poems?

Dr. Goddard moves beyond theory and invites you to directly experience the power of essential oils to inspire creativity, enhance motivation and ease toxic stress. As a part of this workshop you will receive samples of pure essential oils.

Should you wish to purchase materials or oil samples to promote your journey of discovery there will be a fee of $30.00.
results.name: See, Smell, Touch & Taste: Aromas as a Pathway to Creativity

Location: 40 Rector Street, 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10006

Register Now!

The National Ballet of China, a beloved national symbol in its homeland and an iconic cultural emissary to the global community, will make a landmark appearance at China Institute together with Mme. Feng Ying, renowned ballerina and Artistic Director of the National Ballet of China. She will speak about this renowned danced company and the evolution of ballet in China, touching on the differing styles and how the company¹s storied traditions continue to develop in the present day, with dancers from the company demonstrating key points.

Perhaps best known to American audiences as the dance company that performed for President Nixon on his historic visit to China in 1972, The National Ballet of China has achieved a well-earned reputation as a truly world-class dance company. The company is distinguished by its spectacular performances of imaginative new ballets and phenomenal interpretations of traditional masterworks from the classical repertoire. Its unique style, imbuing characteristics of its Russian training and techniques picked up from Western counterparts with a distinctly Chinese flair, presents an unforgettable spectacle to its audiences.

Founded in December 1959, The National Ballet of China fuses classical and modern styles to present works bearing its distinct national characteristics. Schooled in the Russian tradition, the company is known worldwide for its adaptations of Western classics including Swan Lake, Don Quixote, and Giselle, as well as original ballets including The Red Detachment of Women, Raise the Red Lantern, The Peony Pavilion, and The Crane Calling. As a dance company renowned for the quality of its performances on the international stage, The National Ballet of China serves as a cultural envoy from the Chinese people to the world.

For questions or to register by phone, please contact Aaron Nicholson at[masked] ext. 138 or by email at <a>[masked]</a>
results.name: Ballet in China: From Swan Lake to “Red” Ballets

results.description:
See, smell, touch and taste in this interactive workshop. Instructor: Dr. Paul Goddard, Clinical Psychologist. Experience for yourself the enchantment, inspiration and creativity of essential aromas in the artistic atmosphere of the Soho Photo Gallery. 

Mother Nature is an unrivaled expert when it comes to Creativity. At our workshop, immerse yourself in a sensory experience. Come to better understand the power of your amazing sense of smell. Perhaps you remember the aroma of fresh baked bread or chocolate chip cookies fresh from the oven. Learn about gifts of the earth that awaken creativity: savor herbal tea, experience essential oils, embrace aromatherapy techniques that many find indispensable to remain grounded and creative amidst the commotion of city life.

Which aromas energize? Increase focus? Ease stress? Arouse creativity?

Mother Nature loves Creativity - she inspires us with so many sights, sounds, smells, flavors and sensations.
Our ability to breathe and smell is profoundly evocative.
Fragrance is a subtle but very powerful pathway to creativity.

Even long ago, the geniuses knew about the power of fragrances. Leonardo da Vinci was said to be passionate about essential oils, and was famed for surrounding himself with perfumes. Even Shakespeare's father was a glover who was known to use extensive amounts of essential oils. Could this have been a contributing factor to the creation of 39 plays, 154 sonnets and countless poems?

Dr. Goddard moves beyond theory and invites you to directly experience the power of essential oils to inspire creativity, enhance motivation and ease toxic stress. As a part of this workshop you will be given samples of pure essential oils.

Should you wish to purchase materials or oil samples to promote your journey of discovery there will be a fee of $30.00.
results.name: Interactive Workshop: Aromas as a Pathway to Creativity

results.description:
Event space and refreshments sponsored by Work Market


Event agenda:

6:30 - 7:00 PM: Networking & Food  

7:00 - 7:15 PM: Lightning Talks (5 mins each)  

7:15 - 8:30 PM: Keynote talk by Jon Krohn 

8:30 - 9:00 PM: Socializing

Sign up to give a 5 minute talk by filling out your information HERE! Your talk can simply be an introduction of who you are and what you work on, or you can cover some aspect of Machine Learning or Data Science that you find interesting.  This is open to everyone and we encourage people of all skill levels to give a talk.  It's a great way to introduce yourself to the group!


Keynote Talk Description

As the Chief Data Scientist of a New York-centric digital recruitment platform, Jon has unusual access to the attributes hiring managers are responsive to. Jon will cover:

- the features that lead to successful applications for software engineering roles, as suggested by thousands of statistically-modeled cases

- the most in-demand data science skills, both hard and soft, and their relationship to compensation

- advice from experts on interview preparation

- the utility of open-source data sets and ideas for obtaining insights from them efficiently

- the world-improving impact machine learning practitioners can have

About the Speaker

Jon is the Chief Data Scientist at untapt, a venture capital-backed digital platform that automates the job-seeking process for technically-skilled candidates like data scientists and software engineers. By employing natural language processing, supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, untapt optimizes the identification of fulfilling career opportunities. Jon earned his doctorate in neuroscience at Oxford University, where he published peer-reviewed papers on the use of computational statistics, including machine learning, to analyze the large-scale data of genetic and brain imaging research. Prior to joining untapt, Jon used algorithms to trade commodities at a Singaporean hedge fund as well as to serve digital advertisements at North America’s largest media agency.

Jon’s twitter:  @data_jk

Jon’s LinkedIn:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/jonkrohn

Jon’s website: jonkrohn.com
results.name: Modeling the Success of Software Developer Job Applications

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each meeting will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. 

Check out our group guidelines.

This week's meeting will be peer-led by Mindful Astoria community members Paul, Rob, and Ally. 

Peer-led meetings are more informal gatherings led by regular community members with a dedicated meditation practice. Peer-leaders discuss the basic instructions for meditation, keep time during the sit, and facilitate group discussion and sharing. 

Ally will offer some gentle mindful stretching as well.

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
